name: Matt St. John
text: Cool!  I get the first review.  You know, most of these places are ran pretty well, being a huge corporation, but I was just VERY impressed with David at this location, and will be coming back here again and giving them first option for my business.  Being smart, kind, efficient, and straight-shooting should be something people can expect from a business, but as most know in this age of millennials who think everything should be handed to them, it is not the case anymore.  If Advance keeps employing men (and women) like David, they will be around for a LONG time....

name: Shannon Sullivan
text: CarQuest has permanently closed. But Advance Auto Parts has opened up in this same building.

name: J R
text: Took my truck here in Oct of 2020 and they forgot to reconnect the sway bar up front, which I fixed. Then gave them a second chance with my wife's car and just discovered they only replaced 3 of the 5 lug bolts on one wheel. Now I have to buy new lug bolts. Go somewhere else if you want the job done correctly.

resp.text: Our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! I see that we have already opened a customer service ticket, we will be back in touch soon!

name: Amanda
text:
As a woman I can say that I have never had a good experience in places when getting my car serviced.  I am spoken down to, given hidden charges, and just treated with general disrespect.
But this was absolutely not the case coming here. Ricky was incredibly nice and spoke to me like an actual human being. I told him what I needed and what time I needed it done. Not only was it done in the exact time I needed, he called to verify what we discussed and verify the price. He did not try to sell my anything unnecessary. And the price wasn't a penny over what he told me. It was an amazing experience and it will be the only place I get my car serviced for the foreseeable future. Thank you for your respect and impeccable service.

resp.text: Thanks for the stars, Amanda! Glad the team was able to take such great care of you. Take care!

name: Kevin Stephens
text: This review is more for an employee than the store itself. Not to take away from the store, though, the store is great. Tire Tech, Ricky, deserves a large amount of praise. That gentleman works his behind off. Every time I’m in the store, he’s there. Working hard. He’s got a fantastic attitude and a general willingness to help. If someone from Tire Discounters sees this, give that man a raise.

resp.text: Awww, thank you for the 5-star review and the kind comments Ricky. We are so glad you had a great experience Kevin, we do what we do for customers just like you. Please come back and see us again when you need us and stay safe out there!

name: Claire Tomlin
text:
Fantastic service! They helped me with my tire issue and Ima go back to them for all my tire needs!

Pros: Honest and down to earth; easy to talk to!

Cons: a bit standoffish at first but it may have been the weather (Torrential downpour)

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Claire! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: William Swinson
text: Joseph the manager and his staff have been phenomenal. Great prices and the service is simply outstanding. He and his team helped me solve a major problem that 2020+ Ram 1500 have major complaints about due to tire shimmy at certain speeds. They fixed the entire problem by performing a “dynamic balancing” splitting the needed weights and road force validation. So these folks saved me from a problem that most folks can’t figure out. Truck runs smooth as silk now and these guys were a pleasure to work with. I will NEVER NEVER take my vehicles anywhere else. You guys just made me a customer for life. Just so you know, I make a living teaching organizations how to be efficient and “customer-centric” and these guys rock !!!! Thanks guys!!!!! Ed

resp.text: That’s how we roll, William! Glad we were able to take such good care of you. Thanks, and we’ll see you again down the road!

name: Ryan Cass
text: For the last 5 years I’ve been taking my Camry to NTB in Huntsville and they were fine until they started trying to up sell me on stuff I didn’t need and their prices kept going up with the staff becoming less and less friendly too. When Tire Discounters opened up on Winchester road I looked forward to trying them out since they are much closer and after having some work done on my other vehicles I knew this would be the right place to get a fresh set of tires. They had a great sale going on for Pirelli’s and they are driving great, hopefully they maintain their friendly service and good prices because this is where I’ll be going for the life of my new tires.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll! We're the authority in customer service and auto safety, Ryan. See ya in 5000 miles for your 1st of many free lifetime tire care visits. We want to take make sure we take good care of those new puppies.

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Great service.. free tire and break inspection.

resp.text: Thank you for the stars Timothy! We appreciate you being a valued Tire Discounters customer. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

resp.text: The Sutton Road location is da bomb! Thank you for the 5-star review, very much appreciated. We are soooo glad that you had a great experience, and glad you liked the "skip the shop" service! Your time is important and we appreciate you being a valued customer. Spread the word and stay safe out there!

Best Tire shop in the area!! Great customer service! They are super helpful and explain things well!!! They’re great at what they do and they do things quickly! I recommend them to everyone! :)
Thanks tire discounters :)

resp.text: Best customers! Thank you for the kind words, Regan. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

text: Had an emergency today that required purchasing 4 new wheels and 2 new tires. Joseph went above and beyond to help me get what I needed and my car was finished and ready to when I got off work! The entire staff was friendly! I highly recommend Tire Discounters! 5 star service!!

resp.text: That's how we roll! We are the authority in auto safety, Kim. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

text: Best Shop. You want your vehicle running right and customer service at 5 stars then this location is the stop. Especially if you have Rick handling you vehicles service/repair. Thanks guys.

resp.text: Rick is TOP NOTCH! Happy to have ya in the TD family, Kyle. You've got us for life.

name: Terry Smith
text: Only 1 tech there.  2 went home the day we were there. Who knows why.  We had appt to get a flat fixed and by 1230 we were ready to make earliest appt. Next day.  The woman said we should have made appt anyway.  Well we did... we told her when we walked through the door. So she looked and got pretty nervous.  They got us in ASAP ands we finally got the tire fixed.  Overall we will use our tire discounters on W72 and county line. We were out of town and Hampton Cove was thre closest. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Terry, our apologies that we did not meet your expectations, not what we want to have happen! We definitely care about your experience and we'd like to connect to learn more. If you would like to discuss, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com so we can get back in touch with you. Please include a copy of your review for reference, we hope to hear back from you soon! Thank you and stay safe!

name: Madison
text: My day started out with a flat tire on my car. I took my car here and the nice staff at tire discounters did not hesitate to fix my tire for me! 10/10 would be back again.

resp.text: That’s how we rock so you can roll Madison! Thank you for the feedback and 5-star review! We work hard to provide you with a great experience. Please come back to see us again when you need us. Stay safe out there!

name: Dan Nguyen
text: Awesome service! The staff is very  quick, attentive and professional. They patched my SUV for FREE and cleaned the wheels. We were just about to head out for a road trip so this was great. I'll definitely be coming back when those tires need to be replaced.

resp.text: Rockin' and rollin'! Glad we could keep ya rollin' safely, Dan. Hope you enjoyed your trip and we'll see ya again when ya need us.

name: Stefanie Terrell
text: Do not take your vehicle here unless you’d like something coincidentally to happen requiring an additional repair. My husband took his vehicle here for a tire patch which resulted in him being told he needed new tires due to uneven wear. He received a quote and agreed to pursue the new tire service. During service, he was told that his alignment was extremely off; although he had taken his vehicle to the dealership for routine maintenance. They drove his vehicle to our house (courtesy drop-off) and didn’t even mention that the vehicle was making a grinding noise when accelerating and slowing down (4WD issue). Deceitful and dishonest. Their management told my husband that this was a coincidence and a known issue with the make and model of his vehicle. Then proceeded to give him a quote to repair. BUYER BEWARE

resp.text: We have strict policies in place to never oversell unnecessary items and follow MAP guidelines when making any product or service recommendations. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concerns, Stefanie. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

text: Very convenient. They picked up car and dropped it off at no expense. Staff was very courteous. We will be repeat customers.

resp.text: Skip the Shop is AWESOME, right?! So glad you were able to take advantage of that service, Seth. Take care and we'll be here anytime ya need us.

Second time through trial and error we got my A/C up and running. Then most recently I found my self having to make frequent trips to bham and my car started overheating.  You guys got it right in and fixed that too!!!  Just got back from Bham and not once did it even act like it was thinking about over heating.  HEROS I tell ya!!!!!!  You guys rocks. text: I've been coming to RoadMart for two years now and I am now having the worst time with them. I brought my car in a week ago because the front end of the car was not driving properly. RoadMart said that they could not replicate the issue but they did see I needed my tires balanced, I let them balance my tires and when I left I was having the same issues. I brought my car back and then they said the tires were  separating on the inside, so I paid 367 for four brand new tires. Replacing the tires only helped the car drive smoother but the problem was now worse! So I brought my car back today and now there saying that the back tires are the cause of the front tires shifting and that wasn't something they could fix, I would have to take it to the dealership. The guy said he could try to align the front to see if that would help but it made the issue even worse then when I had initially brought the car in. I am now sitting here after closing hours so they can set my alignment back to were it was. I just feel like if they were unable to repair the car in the first place then they should've said so instead of me coming out of 446 dollars for no reason. I asked if I could a refund for the alignment and the guy said that he wouldn't be able to refund me, would have to wait until next call and ask for a refund or he could credited as two free oil changes which is not acceptable for my inconvenience

text: Oil change was extremely to high it cost twice as much as the dealership would charge. But they are fast but was away to high .

resp.text: Mr.Thompson, we are sorry that you didn’t find our prices appealing. Your invoice reflects that you purchased a full synthetic oil change plus an air filter. We strive to be price competitive in the industry while continuing to provide high quality products and employ a well-trained staff with years of experience to get the job done quickly and correctly! We do offer coupons and discounts, but we are ultimately known for quick and top-quality professional service. Thank you for your feedback.

name: M. C.
text: I took all 5 of our vehicles to them for two years and all was great. For no reason other than to up-sale us, THE MANAGER began lying to my wife about what she needed. He told her her brand new car with less then 7k miles needed a new air filter, she couldn't switch from synthetic to conventional oil without damaging her engine and she couldn't use the coupon specifically from Fausak that she just printed that morning because it was no longer honored. They did not reset the oil change counter and did not fill the wiper fluids - likely because my wife did not fall for their pitch. When I confronted him, he admitted to the lies and said he wouldn't do it again. Not acceptable. Moving on...

resp.text: We take your feedback very seriously and would appreciate the opportunity to further discuss your concerns. What you describe does not reflect our high standards of professional and honest service. We'd like the chance to learn more about your experience and in hopes of working towards your complete satisfaction. Please send your contact information and availability to reviews@fausaktire.com. Thank you.

name: Jonathan Pettus
text:
I'm not satisfied because I ordered an alternator on Wednesday around 11am. Was told it would arrive around noon on the next day, Christmas eve day. I called and was told it had not been ordered. I'm a disabled kidney dialysis patient and I depend on this little truck to get me to the dialysis center. I had to re-order the alternator and I have to wait until Monday after Christmas before I can get the truck fixed. This is only the most recent issue from this store I've experienced. Please, can someone hire a more competent employee....  UPDATE ... I called again on Monday after Christmas and was told that they ordered a starter by mistake. I  can not believe the incompetence of the employees here.

It seems that the responder to this post has also failed to pay attention. Is this a company wide incompetence? In the future I would suggest using other automotive parts dealers. No, i have not gotten the alternator yet. But I do hope the other store i ordered from has the correct part. I am planning on picking it up today.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience caused by our Opp location with the ordering of your alternator. It sounds as if they have handled it correctly now but feel free to keep us updated. We will be forwarding your review to the Field Leadership of the store so they can see how their customers feel about the service provided and address it as needed. We hope to see you return and thank you for choosing Advance.

name: André Garcia
text:
It's ok for the price.  However the reason they don't get the extra 3 stars is because they are always trying to sell you stuff you don't need, which is why I stooped coming back to this place before. Decided to give it a try and it was the same think.

The service guy called me in the garage to show me "something on my car".  He had the air filter open and he pointed to it and pointed to my EXHAUST MANIFOLD and told me that my injectors and inside "there" was full of  "gunk" and that I needed a fuel injector cleaning for $59.   FIRST, the fuel injectors are NOT inside the EXHAUST MANIFOLD or the air filter.  Second, unless you took apart my valve cover you HAVE NO IDEA how clean/dirty my injectors are.  My car is fairly new which quite low mileage and very well maintained,  don't try to scam me into something that I DON'T need,  or even if I did you wouldn't know simply by pointing to my Exhaust Manifold.

There is a good reason the place across the street "Firestone" was packed with people and they are more expansive and this place was empty.  It's called HONESTY.

resp.text:
Dear André,
We are sorry your last visit to our auto shop did not meet your expectations. Our staff is well trained to identify maintenance issues on each vehicle we diagnose. We are a family owned honest, friendly, and affordable auto maintenance shop. We'd greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss your concerns further, in hopes of reaching a positive resolution. Please contact one of the owners at your earliest convenience, in hopes of making this right with you. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham
(205) 637-5523

name: Jade Howlet
text: I never had an experience so BAD! I get my tires rotated and oil changed. I come back to get the same services done. The mechanic tells me whoever rotated my tires last stripped my lug nut post. When they realize they were the ones who did it they tell me I need to sign a waiver for them to try to fix it or pay for a whole new post! I will never be back!

resp.text:
Dear Jade,
We really appreciate our customers and continuously strive to provide excellent customer service. Our records do not show you as a client of ours. Is there a possibility the transaction is under a different name? We are happy to discuss any issues you might have with your vehicle and try to reach a reasonable solution.
Please give us a call at (205) 637-5523 at your earliest convenience. Thank you!
~ Jamie and Rick Martin, Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Trent Daniels
text: Front desk lady was very nice. The gentleman working on my truck was very informative. I always come here for an oil change, doesnt take long at all. You cant beat these prices

resp.text:
Dear Trent,
We wanted to say a big "thanks" for your nice review. We will certainly pass along the compliments to our staff. We enjoy taking great care of our customers by delivering affordable pricing and efficient services. Customers like you make our jobs rewarding and enjoyable. Thank you!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Justin McClew
text: Nice people that don't do nice work. Took it for the premium oil change. Told me all the belts and hoses looked good, air filter was good everything is topped off, but my radiator was leaking. Soon as I left there was a big vibration in it... Let the car sit for 3days, both radiator hoses needed to be replaced, leaking because of corrosion, the air filter was horrible, the pcv valve was clogged, power steering that doesn't leak was empty and the vibration was because they put 2 quarts more oil than the engine was supposed to have!! Quoted me a price to get a radiator when it was a hose they told me was good!

name: monica mitchell
text: I am sitting here now for the third time since a tune up and oil change last week. As soon as I drive off I noticed my car was missing in a cylinder. Had to come back and get a coil replaced immediately. Also my power steering fluid was extremely low and my coolant level was low. once again drove off and noticed oil burning. I couldn't come right back but came back a few days later and it was the plug gasket. So either it wasn't checked when the oil was drained or the tightest plug too tight. Once again even left after gasket replace and car is still burning oil. Now it smokes too. Telling me it's the axle boot which is messed up but none of this began until immediately after I've left from getting service done here. I'm so disappointed because the last time I was here I had such a good experience I thought I had found my new spot to get work done on my car.

resp.text:
Dear Monica,
We are very sorry you are experiencing auto issues. We have checked our records and our auto center does not show the name used on the review as a customer at our auto shop. We would like to assist you in finding a positive resolution and ask that you give one of us a call at the number shown below. We are happy to talk with you at your earliest convenience. Thanks so much!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

(205) 637-5523

name: Kristyn Taylor
text: I drive all the way from Southside to bring my car here. They are faster than that express place, at half the price but with better service.  The last time I was there, the tech noticed how terrible my headlights were and let me know they were running a special to fix them for just $20. Now I don't have to drive with my brights on!

name: Mrs. Williams
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!! I REPEAT!! SAVE YOUR CAR AND MONEY AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! My husband took his Classic Car here for an detailed  job , after picking up the vehicle the following Monday it would not crank. Upon returning my husband was told that they will not be able to work on his car after receiving the money to fix the issue.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Williams,
We are saddened to read this review. Our staff has tried to work with your husband and his classic car in a patient, honest, and friendly manner. We feel like we have done everything we could to assist you and wish you all the best.
~Jamie and Rick Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jeremy Hinton
text: They corrected several issues that left my car unsafe. They were fast, courteous and did a great job. I'll be recommending them to friends!

resp.text:
Dear Jeremy,
Thanks so much for posting the 5-star review of our auto services. It is so nice to read that you received fast and courteous auto repair services during your recent visit to our shop. The recommendations are greatly appreciated and we look forward to seeing you again. All the best!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Drew Cottrell
text: Ive heard this location has been shut down but ive been here recently, great service

resp.text:
Hello Drew,
Your patronage at our auto center is greatly appreciated. Thanks for the compliment on our auto services.

You are correct, we have closed this location and plan to relocate about 25 miles away close to Finley Avenue and Farmers Market. We also have a Precision Tune Auto Care center in Alabaster, which is only 6 miles away from our old Pelham shop.

We hope to see you again so we can continue providing you with excellent auto maintenance services. Thank you!
~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care

name: D F
text: They test the cars they service by flying up and down hilltop business dr as fast as they can.

resp.text:
Dear Drew,
Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We too have noticed that there seems to be a lot of vehicles driving faster than they should on Hilltop Drive. Please know that we have addressed this concern with  our employees and have emphasized how important it is to follow the speed limit at all times. Safety is our number one concern in our shop, and also as we test drive any vehicles. If you have any additional questions, or concerns, please feel free to call the store manager, Kevin Gainey, at (205) 637-5523. Thank you very much!

name: Amy Lynn Butler
text: I WAS a long time client until this weekend when they over charged us (found out too late after spending over $650!!) & my husband gave them instructions to leave our car locked outside of their shop, for us to pick up, since we couldn't come until after they were closed. Not only was our car not outside for us, it was still on the rack with the hood up in the shop!! We had to back track to our house & my husband was late for his job! We are VERY disappointed. We have literally spent thousands there through the years. And we are done.

name: Jennifer Cargile
text:
My husband went in with his CRV on a Saturday about 9am for a normal oil change and a check engine light, was told that he needed some spark plugs and new oil pan gasket (there were NO oil leaks that we had noticed, and we were told it was loosing 80% of its oil) and was told it wouldn't take long at all, maybe an hour,  well he didn't leave until after 12 (receipt said 1217). He asked multiple times if it was ready, was told only 20 more mins, then 30...well 2 hours after the said time he left. We had plans at 11am, so those didn't happen WHICH could have been planned for-like loading up my kids (one being a newborn) in the car and picking him up. No apologies for the extra wait time and never honest about how long it was going to take.
Come that following week, SURPRISE, there was an oil leak on the garage floor AND the check engine light was back on. So we took it back once again. He was told that it was just old oil coming out and it was fine and that some other piece needed to be replaced for the check engine light. Like why wasn't this fixed the first time!? Unless we got super unlucky and something went wrong within the 3/4 day time.

Well now it's about 4 months later and there's still oil spots on the floor!
So we called today, I got a so-so person on the phone and was told to bring it back in, no "oh my goodness! That's not what we like to hear..please bring it back in!" It was just "bring it back".

1st, can we make the comparison on the comment from Ashton Morgan below?? This was the SAME day, the SAME time and my husband remembers talking and waiting with Ashton.
We aren't very knowledgable on car repairs and we should've gotten a 2nd opinion(the Garage in Pelham is literally walking distance and everyone always has great things to say about them, but this was just for a cheap oil change-never again!) ..but we just had a baby and didn't have much spare time or sleep to decide these things with a clear mind.

I just reccomend going somewhere else for piece of mind EVEN for an oil change, even if this was just a random bad day (which look at the rating-use your brains people! We didn't and now we're paying for it with our time and now a nasty driveway and garage floor) for the people working on cars, there has yet to be a verbal apology-and now if we get one it will just seem forced.

resp.text:
Dear Jennifer,
My name is Rick and I am the owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham. We wanted to apologize for the long wait during your last visit with us. We know our customers time is valuable and we always strive to provide a reasonable time estimate on each service we perform. I can assure you we addressed the waiting issue and are thrilled to have a new store manager.

Our records show we serviced your vehicle in early February 2016. We offer a 12-month warranty on all services and encourage you to contact us at (205) 637-5523 to set up a follow-up appointment. Since your vehicle has over 189,000 miles on it, there may be another leak requiring some attention. We look forward to making this right with you. Thank you!

name: Michelle Thompson
text: Quick oil change! Very nice staff!!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing our auto shop for your recent oil change, Ms. Thompson. We love our customers and appreciate your business very much. We look forward to seeing you again for any of your other car care needs.  ~ Jamie, Owner of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Jarrard Blanco
text: Very prompt service and a knowledgeable, courteous staff.

resp.text:
Dear Jarrard,
It is great to read that our staff was able to provide you with prompt and knowledgeable auto repair services, topped off with great customer service. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you for your business!
~Rick and Jamie Martin, Owners of Precision Tune Auto Care of Pelham

name: Michael Johnson
text: My wife took her SUV here last week for oil change and now I have oil puddles all over my driveway!!!!!

resp.text:
Dear Michael,

We apologize for your mishap regarding your recent visit to Precision Tune Auto Care, Hilltop.  It is our goal to make sure each person has a positive experience with us.  It's customers like you that help us to make adjustments in our shops, to better serve you and other customers.  This has been pointed out to the employees so this doesn't happen again.  We are sorry for what happened and we thank you for your feedback.

Sincerely,
Rick Martin
205-637-5523

name: Claude Lansdell
text: Bought a lifetime balance and rotation 56,000 miles ago.  Managed to get it done 3 times.  The last time I lost a center cap and all 4 tires had different air pressure.  Wal-Mart claimed they have proof from video cameras it was done properly.   Prior to this it had been about 12,000 miles since the last rotation.  I had made numerous attempts to have this done and was told it would be about a 4 hour wait.  Another attempt I was told it would be about 3 hours.  Again I was told they had now idea when they could get to it.   I asked to make an appointment but was told I couldn't.   I now have a set of Michelin tires with uneven wear.  A waste of $36, a waste of a new set of Michelin tires and the toll it takes on a person who has to try to communicate with people who have no communication skills and just don't care.   Do yourself a favor and go anywhere but here.

name: Covenant Wildlife
text: Decided to give this new location a shot with one of my companies trucks that needed tires. After they installed the tires I left and within 30 min the TPS light came on. The technician never calibrated the sensors. I called the store and told them what happened and the guy said to bring it back by and I told him that it would have to be tomorrow as I had a full route planned and did not expect it to take over 2 hours to just install 4 tires and that I was late for my customers. I asked if I could bring it by in the am and he said that was fine that the tech would calibrate the sensors and that it would only take a min to do. I show up this am  (after clearing some time on my calendar) and I tell the guy who I am and what I am there for and he informs me that they have no mechanic available to do this and that I would have a pretty long wait. I tell him that if the tech did his job correctly, I would not even have to be here a second time. He just says sorry. So I make an appointment for Tuesday to come back a tired time for something the tech should have done right in the beginning. I will take my fleet plus my personal cars elsewhere. Probably go right next door to Christian Brothers.

name: Craig Winn
text: Love the Firestone auto care locations. One of the service reps from the Pelham location is moving here. Great guy and lots of help. Looking forward to this addition in our neighborhood.

name: Richard Thompson
text:
Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.
I spent 10 minutes on the phone the day before letting the guy know that I was in search of a car mechanic I could trust to tell me what NEEDS to be fixed on my car, not what makes them the most money.  He assured me they would take care of me and he completely understood and that I could trust them.  The next day, after bringing my car in, it was clear they were trying to upsell with strong recommendations for everything from new tires (still have 5k-10k of tread) to all new brakes and rotors for the whole car to the $130 "fuel treatment system", to a NEW SUSPENSION FOR MY CAR.  Yes, they tried to recommend I buy a new suspension system.

I will never go there again and will go find a different mechanic I can trust.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: Fast and friendly service! I had something stuck in my tire and I only had to wait about 30 minutes for them to repair it and get it back on my van. I will definitely be back!

name: Richard Gayheart
text: My initial experience was pleasant and we discussed what was necessary to fix the truck. I needed to order a specialty part to finish the work. When I brought the part in, there was a different person running the front. At that point, things went downhill. Now I needed several new parts. The person was condescending and spoke to me like I didn’t have a clue. After I explained I had cleared the repairs with the first person and we had emailed the parts needed, this new person demanded to see the email. I retrieved the email and the reply was ‘wow, that was an expensive part’ and told me I needed more parts. I left the store because further conversation was not going to improve the situation. The next day I called the store and spoke with the original front person. My issues were resolved and the truck was fixed, but I will not return based on the second person I interacted with.

name: Tim Hedderly
text: Employees are friendly and personable.  I live in Helena, but will (am) traveling to the 280 location for this service.

name: Brent Curtin
text: I'm a little disappointed.  i went in to see if they could patch my tire.  its run flat so they said they couldn't.  said i need to buy a new tire.  that's ok.  was told that at other locations.  but then he told me that i need 2 new tires on the back as well.  my car is brand new and has 18,000 miles on it and i know tires can go bad at 18,000 miles, unlikely, but can happen.  that was a real turn off trying to sell something not needed.  when i used to go to another of their locations in mobile, the girls and guys down there had me running on slicks before they tried to sell me a tire.  they made sure i didnt buy tires until i really needed them and they had my loyalty.  trying to rip people off isnt a way to get return customers especially when they are putting competition right across the street from you.  just my opinion.

name: Andrew Monaghan
text: Hance Auto Parts is my favorite auto parts store.  I am not a professional mechanic but I am learning how to do things I used to pay someone else to do.  Jack and his wife are very gracious, kind, and, best of all, patient!  Just the other day, I had to replace a front drive axle on my wife's Subaru.  They had the part in stock and made sure I had all of the small parts needed to correctly do the job.  Jack even answered some novice questions for me.  It really helped me maintain the confidence I needed to get the job done.  And, in case you are wondering, their prices are in line with everyone else and they can get the parts you need if they do not have them in stock.  They also do machine shop work and Jack has a super cool water jet metal cutting machine in the back that he might show you if you are lucky.  I highly recommend these people and their store.

text: Jack was really friendly and kind. I couldn't get through to my mother, who lives near the Post Office, or through to anyone else in the area, but I kept trying.  I got on Google Maps to see if I could find any local businesses and found Hance Auto Parts.  As chance would have it, they have an extra DSL line, so their phones were still working.  He assured me that the area where my mother lives in Magnolia Springs was fine.  It was so nice to talk to a man with southern charm and kindness.  THANK YOU!!

name: Tom Stofer
text: I went to the Dadeville, AL, AutoZone Auto Parts store on Monday, Jan. 6, to purchase a battery for my lawn tractor. They had the battery I wanted but the shelf date was several months old. I asked a store employee if their batteries were routinely rotated and he said they were. The employee further told me that their delivery truck would be there on Wednesday. He seemed to indicate the truck would bring newer dated batteries. I left my name and number but never got a call. The following Monday I visited the store again and spoke to the same employee. He checked and said they didn't get any newer batteries in. He said he was going to the Alexander City store that afternoon and would see if they had a newer battery. He again said he would call me either way and let me know. I confirmed that he still had the note with my name and number. And again he never called. I sent an email to AutoZone's national website regarding their lack of customer service. They replied and said that my email was being forwarded to the district manager and that I would be contacted within 24 to 48 hours. That didn't happen either. I sent a second email to AutoZone letting them know that the district manager never contacted me. They said my second email was also forwarded to the district manager.A day or two later the district manager finally attempted to contact me. But by then I had already purchased a battery at O'Rielly's Auto Parts where, I must say, I received much better customer service.

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, Tom. We're disappointed to hear you did not have a great experience with our team. We strive to help you in any way we can with your automotive needs. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are always improving and hope you give us another chance to win back your trust and confidence.

name: Donnie Coleman
text:
Filed on : January 30 2014

Filed by :
Donald Coleman
359 South Montcrest
Cullman AL 35057

Filed against :
Stewart Auto Supply, Inc.
1211 Loring Nw
Cullman AL 35055

Complaint Description:
worst machine work i have seen in my life ,and the machinist is rude and not willing to make things right. Took my 6.0 LQ4 block, crank and heads to have them reworked, cleaned and check to see if they were still within spec limits. We discussed engine gaskets rebuild kits. I left and then called on the phone to discuss more pricing and gaskets again. I went back to stewarts to bring some more parts to be cleaned but on that visit talked again about rebuild kits and gaskets. Now each time i talked to the owner about the gasket sets i asked, were they felpro? his answer every time was yes they will be felpro. He gave me a price which was little more then what i had search online for but i decided to go with his kit since the gaskets were definitely felpro . well is snowed the next day and roads were closed so i had to wait another day for him to finish. roads were still bad so he came in late but he was finished around lunch time. So when i get there to pick up my parts i ask where is the rebuild kit. The machinist shows me the box and the gaskets sets are not felpro, they are Victor reins gaskets. I refused to buy the kit because he told me a they would contain felpro. The machinist told me that felpro and victor reins were made by the same company that they were the exact same gaskets. That was his first lie too me. Those are two entirely different companys, with different pricing and materials. so we deducted the kit and now i owe for the machine work done, which is 345.00 I pay the balance go home and start unloading the block and notice the cam bearing that they installed for me were damaged from the installation too. Took it back and the owner said he doesn't know any other way to put those bearings in. well duh!!! but you don't damage them when they go in , if you do damage them then you take them out and install new ones. but they sent me home with that crap. so i decided to look over the heads real good since things are already not good. well the heads are aluminum heads , they look as if someone took a wire brush to clean the mating surfaces on the heads. they are scratched badly. there are several scratches going across the from one cylinder to the other which will leak when it is installed back on the block. So i took the heads back to stewarts this morning and asked to talk to someone about this and the owner wasn't there but the machinist was. so i showed the head to the machinist and asked what he did to it. he said he milled it. i asked is that acceptable? he said yes. i asked if he could show me any where in writing, online or any mechanic that can tell me that those scratches on the mating surface of the head was acceptable .The machinist looked at me and said pick my head up and get the hell out of there. You can imagine what my response was. :) but I'm not happy with this and the place of business is just horrible. I have been building engines for over 23 years and i have never seen anyone tell me that scratches on a aluminum head was acceptable to install. They refused to take of this and now i have to take the heads and have them resurfaced if they can even be resurfaced again. i also heve to take the block and crank to another machine shop to have them check and correct everything stewarts touched. BEWARE SHOTTY WORK AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. STAY AWAY if you want good work performed.

Your Desired Resolution:
At this point all i want is a complete refund for the services they performed. I tried to go back to talk to them and i was told to get the hell out of their store. The work performed was bad and i don't fell comfortable letting them touch anything else of mine.

I will never do business with them again.

name: Kari Jandran
text: We were camping in Gadsden and got a nail in one of our truck tires. We arrived at 7:45 AM, with nobody in line ahead of us. It took them an hour and 15 minutes just to do a tire repair. The gentleman who checked us out told me that they "probably shouldn't have assigned us the slowest guy here to do your repair". It's 9:03 and we are finally pulling out of the driveway. They were nice but it's crazy that a 15 minute job took this long.

name: daniel barnett
text: Took two hours to get a new valve stem and the next morning the tire was flat. Guess they just slapped a new one in and never checked for leaks. Generally a leaking valve stem at the rim gets cleaned up at a quality tire shop

name: justin nichols jr.
text: Worst service I’ve ever experienced. Don’t waste your money here. 3 hrs to change 1 tire. No one stayed working in the bay. Literally saw the guy working on it walk to talk to people and grab a snacks several times..

name: Andrew Feltman
text: Speedy service more like slow as molasses we needed one tire patched up and it took about an hour and 30 minutes

name: Sydney Tinney
text: I will be sure to NEVER buy my tires here again. I will be finding somewhere else that carries my size. It is insane that I have had to purchase 6 tires here since March 2018 all at full price because they claim the tires are bald and the $10 road hazard won't cover. How can tires bought in March be bald in September when there has been NO long distance driving?!? And HOW was my flat tire inflated when it wouldn't hold air and was sitting on the rim when I arrived with it in the back of my car?! I couldn't even get the gentleman who claimed my tires were bald to even speak to me face to face or tell me what he did to my tire!!! Incredibly unprofessional! Incredibly rude! Then charge me $10 for road hazard I didn't want it on the tire I had to pay full price for anyways!? Worse experience at a Wal-Mart EVER.

name: Todd Wilkinson
text: This past weekend I ordered online ( $50.00 savings off the in store price) a set of tires and had the auto center install them on my wifes Envoy at the Wal-Mart of Gadsden. I was greeted quickly by the service writter. I was told up front that the wait time was several hours. Told again by the service manager, told about the road hazard, lifetime rotate and balance, new valve stems, tire disposal fees, I was told to bring the truck back in 50 miles to recheck the lugnut torque, etc. They covered all the bases. I was called at home to verify "blackwall out, right?" This is good service in my opinion, and best of all--the wife is happy with her new tires and I'm happy if she's happy. Keep up the good work you guys!

name: Lacey Harris
text: Sat in line for over 35 minutes while the slowest woman alive took her sweet time getting to the 3 people in line to get oil changes. That is completely unacceptable. I normally use the Attalla Walmart Auto Center, but I decided to attempt this one today because I was closer. Never again. I am usually in and out of the Attalla one in less than an hour and I have never sat in line for more than 5 minutes. Y'all need to step up your game.

name: Chasity Self
text: Did well

name: Lindsey Nibblett
text: They broke the censor on my tire and tried to blame it on the people that worked on it before them. Which i cpuld understamd id it wasnt a 2016 modle!! Horrible experience.

name: Laura Phillips
text: The tires didn't last 3 months. They sold me 4 faulty tires. I will never go there again

name: Patti Baez
text: Went for an oil and tire change. They were out of my tires, was just as expensive of an oil change as anywhere else in town, and took 2hrs.... Not worth it in any way

name: Edie
text: Great price and service on tires for my  grandsons Trailblazer. Thanx guys!

name: Michael Simmons
text: Can't live without our Sam's Club!

name: Carl Crozier
text: When you call the Auto Dept., no answer, put on hold, no answer, I just needed to know if they had the battery I needed in stock since it is not a regular type battery. This battery has to be vinted because it is going in a 1999 Mazda Miata MX5. Called the service desk , they tryed to connect me , luck, done.

name: Rob Trujillo
text: Great sale on tires and batteries today.

name: Ron Hall
text: I would not recommend this location, no customer service or respect for customers time. They do not deserve any stars for today's actions. Stopped by this location Saturday to schedule an oil change for Monday. I dropped off my vehicle at 0700 sharp and asked if it would be complete by 1300. I returned at 1300 to get vehicle and they had not even started, nor did they apologize or try to make up for their lack of customer service. They seemed completely indifferent about not completing the job. I believe that these businesses do not consider the planning that takes place to coordinate vehicle maintenance. I understand things happen but 6 hours to complete an oil change seems reasonable. If there was going to be a problem with completing by 1300, they should have told me at 0700. I took my vehicle and got service completed at Goodyear.

name: Roscket Tasartir
text:
Brought my car in with a nail in a tire, expecting a puncture and needing a patch. They inspected it and found it was only firmly embedded in the tread, no puncture. They removed the nail and even pressure-checked the tire, all without charging me a dime. Thanks!

Keep in mind  that this location is within the Redstone Arsenal, so you'll need to have badge-access to the Arsenal to use their services.

name: Chris Byars
text: Got a great deal on a new set of tires w/ alignment, as well as a brake & rotor change. Service was excellent and fast. I highly recommend them!

name: Aileen Liu
text: Eric was amazing help with my car. Had my whole front strut assembly replaced by his team and gave awesome customer service!! Best Firestone around!

name: Randal Morris
text: Love this firestone

name: John Collins
text: I do not like that I am so familiar with this store but my wife's Acadia has been temperamental of late. The good news is Justin and the chaps at Firestone are great to work with. Highly recommend.

name: Andrew Scott Wallace
text: Courteous and prompt service

name: Chad Weaver
text: Highly recommend this place. Had a little accident on the way back to Maryland and everyone here was friendly and professional. They got us in and back on the road in less than an hour. Really great people here.

name: Greg Gillis
text: Great place had a slight ordering issue with my tires but they worked it out.   The whole team even stayed over to make sure they got my car done .  Can't recommend enough.

name: demetria williams
text: I am completely disappointed with my experience here. I caught a piece of metal in my tire on my way to work so i had to leave work to get my tire replaced, $151 was paid for one tire 215 50R17. A few days later my Tire Pressure Sensor goes off and I add air and recalibrate my tires, just for it to go off again. I called them they told me “our calibration system is down and we did not reset your sensors” which seems like a minor fix of course, but it’s not. Now, if my tire pressure is low, I won’t have any idea because my sensor has not been reset and therefore it is not functioning properly. I now have to leave work, again, find another location and have them correct mistakes that were not disclosed at the time of my visit. Very disappointing. Let’s not halfass any other jobs, if you can not do it right in it’s entirety then you should not be doing it.

name: mayra rodriguez
text: not exactly good but sometimes good

name: Cindy Snyder
text: Left caps off under hood after oiil change on 1 trip. Froze bank account 10 days and refused to help resolve hold after payed by another method on another trip. Payed for unlimited tire rotation and balance with new tirea but they seem to be trying to find ways to loose my business.

resp.text: Cindy, thank you for making us aware of the issues that you encountered when you came in for service. We're truly sorry to hear that this was your experience, and we definitely want to ensure that its addressed. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the complete details of your experience or a link to your review, the store, any invoice numbers, and your contact information. We appreciate your business and thank you for choosing Firestone. ^Alexis

name: Jerod Nolen
text: Great customer service, and a job well done!!!

resp.text: Thanks for choosing Firestone, Jerod! ^Kristyn

name: Linda McMath
text: Thank you! Thank you!  We were on the road between South Carolina and Arkansas. We had a tire that wouldn’t hold air!  After stopping for a repair in Augusta, we continued to lose air pressure and had to stop every hour to put air in my tire.  It was Saturday night, we called this shop, they said someone would be available first thing on Sunday morning to check our tire.   They found a tiny leak the two other Firestone garages had missed.  We were good to go!

name: Erik Marchese
text: Honest, helpful, checked out the car and did not try up sell me things I did not need.  Great to work with.

name: Kim Gann
text: I’ve  used this location multiple times. Great service and fair prices. Highly recommend.

name: Anna Johnson
text: They fixed an issue I was having with my car lock confirmation. They replaced my battery, which was still under warranty, so I got a good price on the replacement. And they only recommended work that I know needed to be done. This is a great shop and I highly recommend them!!!

name: Daryn Salger
text: Barry was great very Courteous and fast I will definitely recommend your Firestone to all my friends thanks again Barry!!

name: Spencer Stiles
text: Place is a disaster. The last 4 times I have taken my car here I have had to take it back the next day because they messed something up. I was contacted by the General Manager AND Area Manager after my surveys. NEITHER of them provided ANY compensation for my wasted time and money. Highly recommend not going here.

name: D-Son Johannes
text: Did a oil change at the 280 location last month and they forgt to put back the engine oil cap..i didnt even notice till lastnight when i see some oily fluid coming out the bumper so i open upbthe hood and realize i the oil cap is missing. I took it in this morning and all they did is put a cap on. I was told it was scrub and clean but i dont think they did any of that..i still gt oil under the hood,the hoses and the covers.. really not recommend going there again.

name: Viliccia Carson
text: Have been waiting for 3 hours just for an oil change!! Would not recommend this location to anyone I know

resp.text: Viliccia, we value your time, and we apologize for the long wait that you experienced during your oil change visit. We'd like to make sure that this is addressed. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, and your contact information. We value your business with Firestone, and hope to hear from you soon. ^Jennifer

name: Sang P.
text: I have been coming here for about 3 years now. Everyone on staff has always been very helpful especially Karen who helped me today. There services offers warranties and they will be more then happy to help you if you have to come back for a warranty check up/repair. Thanks guys!

name: Glyn Goldwire
text: Best customer service I have had in a long time. My car needed a battery replacement on a Sunday afternoon while I will traveling for Oklahoma to Georgia. They replaced it and the cost was less than any nearby auto parts store. Big shoutout to Ms. Tracy and her crew. Roll Tide.

name: Anna Gleason
text: I like that they don’t make commission here so they don’t try to sell you unnecessary stuff but I went in the other day for an oil change and they took an hour...I was the first customer there at 8 AM, there were like 5 employees there and I didn’t get out until 9. The front desk person was very unapologetic and had an attitude about it when it was brought to his attention. Probably won’t be back.

resp.text: Anna, we value your time, and we apologize for the long wait that you experienced during your oil change visit. We'd like to make sure that this is addressed. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, and your contact information. We value your business with Firestone, and hope to hear from you soon. ^Jennifer

name: Stuart Wilson
text:
Everyone was great!  Exceeded my expectations!
Place was orderly and clean with a nice TV.  Associates were very nice and did a repair on my car much faster than was told by two other places. Many Thanks!

name: The Diva Mrs. Ash
text: This will be my home location!! The manager was very professional & handled a error that another location made with my car. He was very fair, nice, & professional!! The workers seemed like they were glad to be employed!! Time, sped of service, cleanliness, professionalism, was all 5 stars!! Thanks Firestone on Hwy 280!! Yall Rock!!

resp.text: Hello, we're thrilled to hear that you had an excellent experience with our team at this location! We want to treat you like family and this experience makes us happy to see. If you need to discuss any concerns you have with your service at the other location, please do not hesitate to reach out to at SocialCare@bfrc.com with further details. Thank you for being a loyal Firestone customer and have a wonderful rest of your day! ^Bryan

name: leader ship
text: They were all right, personality and the work as well.... However it's one of the smallest firestone's I've ever seen.. I had to wait two hours.

resp.text: Hello, we know that your time is valuable and we'd like to ensure that this is addressed. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with these details and your contact information. We appreciate your business and look forward to hearing from you soon. ^Alexis

name: vic rosier
text: Paid $30 + just to have a tire mounted on a spare rim !  Thats Price gouging. And ridiculous then said it would be more to put it on a car !! This is the worst place ever! I have never paid more than 15 for that service anywhere else ! Save yourself and go anywhere else!

name: Paul Taylor
text: Quality of staff will blow your mind. I've been a few times ever since they quoted me 600 bucks under express oil change rate for a particular fix. This most recent time I was there for 3 hours-I like to pay attention to people as Psychology is my major. Every single person that came in(very busy day) treated the staff and other waiting customers like long time best friends. That, I believe starts with their first experience and how this particular store takes you in as family, wants the best for you, and the atmosphere is contagious. It takes a special kind of mechanic shop professional to turn EVERY stressed/worried car owner that steps foot in the door into thankful, optimistic family. To reassure the readers and hopefully future customers of firestone 280, I want y 'all to know I don't gain anything from this review, and honestly I don't know if it will even be on the website lol. Have a blessed day!

name: sherman grant
text: Agree with others who posted negative reviews; these people try to sell you services your car doesn't not need. I took it to get "looked" at for a wheel noise, and they didn't bother taking out on the road, just raised it up and visually looked at it. Go somewhere else and trust your own instinct.

name: Chris Bonds
text: Had a great experience getting a front end alignment. Very help staff who got the job done.

name: Ronni Lessa
text: My a/c stopped working in Mississippi, on my way back from New Orleans to NYC. I was staying over in Birmingham and went over to Firestone first thing in the morning. They were very kind and helpful. They drove me back to my hotel and picked me up, when my truck was finished (earlier than expected). The a/c is working beautifully. I would recommend this particular location of Firestone, to anyone and everyone.

name: Joshua Deason
text: The service here was outstanding! The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I was informed of what services were recommended once my vehicle inspection was complete and was also informed of services that could be needed in the future but were not necessary for this visit. In addition to an inspection and oil change I also had 4 new tires put on my truck and had an alignment completed. A few other customers came in for oil changes only and were in and out in no time at all. I will definitely return with my vehicle for future services!

name: James B
text: Con Artists!  I normally avoid chain stores like Firestone because I know they try to scam people, but it was my last option to get my car examined.  I was helped by a woman I think was named Sabrina, and she fed me the biggest scam I've heard with my car, I don't think she realized I knew more about cars than she probably did.  She told me the tires were done and needed to be replaced NOW, the air filters needed replaced NOW, the battery was dead and needs replaced NOW, and the radiator needed to be flushed - and they'd conveniently do all of this for me at a hefty premium.  I was silently laughing at myself because two of my tires had 20K miles left on them (yes the other two need replacing soon), my air filters were replaced 8 months ago, my battery was brand new (I took it to auto zone AND advanced auto parts and they showed me the readings and the charge was fantastic, they laughed at Firestone for trying to pull one over on me), my radiator was also flushed within the last year.  I finally called her out on the battery and she looked me right in the eye and had the immoral audacity to say the battery was still worthless.  These are common things places like Firestone try to trick people into having repaired, because most people don't have the knowledge to know any better.  It was funny because they didn't even identify the things that were wrong with my car that I knew about.  They checked off that both headlights were working great, even though I knew and verified that one of the front headlights was dead... did they really even look my car over or just pretend to then hand me an appraisal for all the "broken" items I needed to have them fix now?  If you do not know much about cars, do not trust Firestone, they will sense your naivete and pull a fast one on you.  Always get a second opinion from a more reputable garage shop (I prefer privately owned places that rely on their honesty for business).  This just reaffirms the longstanding distrust I've had for places like Firestone, avoid them if you care about your money and your vehicle's longevity.  This visit was a total scam and employees like the one I dealt with do not belong in a customer service position.

name: Em M
text: Service is always great!

name: Chase Lindsey
text: The manager is awesome she matched all my prices and was so sweet it made my stomach hurt

name: KevinLisa Pate
text: They are a great store shop with very good tires and wonderful service!thanks Firestone

name: vnehwal
text:
Appointment scheduling is a fake program. Don't rely on that scheduling service. I scheduled my appointment one day before for 11.30 next day, they told the the service will be done by 12.30. I said great and I will plan accordingly.
went there next day at 11.30, now they say they will try to do it by 12.45 and when i come back at 12.30 they even haven't started yet.  They waisted 2 hours of my time(including going there and back) and still I have to take my car back without service as they wanted more time. Problem is not that they took time, the problem is that how they communicated and mentioned the timelines and did not followed the timelines. What point of scheduling an appointment when it does not have any meaning and you still wait in the queue and on top of that you miss-communicate the customer about timings. Don't you think that they have plan accordingly what you communicate.

name: Paul Pietrowski
text: Wouldn't even say hi to me. Too busy answering the phones to take the time to greet a in store customer.

resp.text: Paul, we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. This is not the type of service that we expect our loyal customers to receive, and we truly apologize. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, the store, and your contact information. We value your business, and we thank you for contacting Firestone. ^Jennifer

name: MADEBYMUNKI
text:
I have been here twice for a tire repair and on one occasion the mechanic messed up my studs and lug nuts not once but twice, however the manager in charge - Sabrina took care of everything professionally. I was reimbursed on the cost of my lug nuts and studs and treated really well with respect. If you are reading this Sabrina, you did one hell of a job, we need more managers like you around.

I would definitely go back if need anything else as the customer service and professionalism is something this branch  can be proud of. God bless.

name: Maximum Gamer
text: The service and professionalism of the technicians and staff, especially Sabrina, is second to none. I can say without reservation if there's an installation needed on your vehicle that you are in safe hands at Firestone.

name: Albert Barginere
text: Off the chain good...every state every time.

name: RICHARD ST JOHN PERDUE
text:
This is a great place to have your car taken care of, especially if you find your dealerships mechanics have grown tired of their profession.

For 20 years I have had nothing but excellent service at this location.

name: Kate Mullen
text: Sabrina, Ryan and Marqies were AMAZING! We rolled into town with a seriously misaligned van and the team at Firestone took great care of us. They were honest, kind and quick.

name: Jim Hutton
text: Two stars because they were nice.  They sell tires and are probably good at it, but saying they do much mechanical work is misleading. I took my truck there, based on a call where they said they could deal with my two issues.  After keeping the vehicle all day, they called to tell me they couldn't fix either issue.  I'm not talking rebuilding a motor.  We're talking a power window off the track and leaking hose. Tires, probably fine. Mechanical work, take vehicle to a mechanic.  I won't go back. As I said,  the staff was very nice, but no help on my issues.

name: Benjamin Tibbs
text: Great service. I have gone several times for oil changes and tire replacement and they have had my vehicle ready promptly and their work has always been fantastic. My go to shop for routine car maintenance.

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text:
This my "go-to" place for an oil change and tires. They have found other problems that could only be fixed by the dealership and let me know about them. They are always friendly and helpful. It is NOT a 10 minute oil change place though! I usually always bring a book to read, or work to do if I am stay and wait for the work to be completed.

I am adding an edit to the review. The previous review was in June 2017. When I took my van for an oil change today I asked for them to check the tire pressure.....they didn't. They also didn't reset my oil change alert on my dashboard. They went from 4 to 3 stars on my review.

name: Stephanie Repass
text: Made an appointment at 11:45 and got there at 11:35. They couldn’t find my appointment. Finally found it and I asked if it would be done within the hour since I was at lunch. He assured me it would. 35 mins later my car hasn’t moved. I go inside to ask what’s going on and the 2 guys at the counter say they’ll be with me in a minute. Meanwhile they’re just talking to each other while I wait for 3-4 mins. Finally I ask for my keys and the guy just hands me my keys and doesn’t say anything. I NEVER write reviews, and I will NEVER go to this location again.

name: Tim Fisher
text:
Changed my oil competently, but tried to upsell me on some other frivolous repairs that would have cost over $100.

How do I know they were frivolous? I had my car at its dealership just last week for a safety recall, and when they did a similar complementary check they found nothing of the sort wrong. Nearly every single number on Firestone's check-up sheet was low-balled by up to 20% from the dealership check-up, and there's no way I got that much wear and tear in a single week.

Bottom line: know what you want when you walk in, and don't let them sell you anything else. If you don't know cars well enough to know a con when you see one, take yours somewhere more honest.

name: Elizabeth Gilmore
text: Driving from South Carolina to Texas, my serpentine belt snapped. Sabrina and the mechanics at Firestone were incredible in explaining to me what happened, what was needed, and recommendations for down the road. I wasn't charged an arm and a leg or ripped off for my lack of knowledge. I'll continue using Firestone sue to this experience.

name: Erica Lattimore
text: Called about a quote on my brakes and tires, instead she was in a hurry to answer the question(s) and just threw a price out there. Ask can she put the make and model of my car in computer instead of just throwing me a quote. Came back a different quote then what she told me. Hire more patient people instead of the Impatient stupid woman that answered the phone.

name: Heart Sigh
text: They are friendly there but if you're in a hurry, don't go there. I went on my lunch break for an oil change. They said 30 minutes. An hour later they hadn't even started. They finally finished almost 2 hours later. Another person I was talking to there he came in before me and was still waiting for his oil change to be finished.

resp.text: Good afternoon. We are truly sorry to hear about the long wait you had when you took your vehicle in to have your oil changed. We know that your time is valuable and we'd like to help get your concerns escalated to our upper management team for further assistance. Please email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, a link to this review, and any invoice numbers related to the oil change. We value your business with Firestone and we hope to hear back from you soon. ^Katrina

name: Reeves Burruss
text: Bought a "new to me" car, and same day took it to Firestone to get a new timing belt because they were the only people open on Sunday (my only off day). I paid 850$ and was assured that the car would be ready that afternoon. I called back later in the day and was told to show up around 4:30 (right before close) to pick up the vehicle. I arrived and was told that they wouldn't leave until it was finished. About 15 minutes later I was told the guy didn't know how to do the job. When I asked how it would be done I was told,"oh, he'll just have to figure it out." The clerk later came out and said it would be the next morning. After asking to leave early from work an hour away, I arrived to a car that made a loud racket from the engine. I was told to leave it there and let their "expert" mechanic look at it the next day. I was told the previous day that the expert mechanic was the one working on it in the first place. I asked to speak to the manager, Vince, who is scum of the earth. He told me he was tired of dealing with my problem and that if I drove it away he wouldn't be liable. Fair warning to anyone looking to have service done at Firestone.

name: Cody C
text: I had a flat tire on a Sunday, so everything else nearby was closed. We pulled up riding on a donut, and they were pretty busy. Since I had a dinner to attend, we couldn't afford to wait. However, the guy was extremely polite and offered to check the pressure in the spare for us. It was too low, so he filled it up for free.

name: Brad Yellock
text: I have used firestone for 16 years. They are just like any other business. Sometimes great, sometimes bad. The particular location on hwy has an associate named Sabrina that works the front. Whenever you see her turn around and leave. If you ask for an oil change and an alignment, you’ll get a tire rotation and washer fluid. That sounds funny but I am not kidding. She is a terrible communicator, and a terrible listener. Everyone else great. She should be happy her teammates are professional and don’t give their true thoughts on her, but you can see the looks on their face when she screws up. I am literally 5 for 5 with screw ups from her not listening. What’s more she had an aditude when she makes a mistake. Again her name is Sabrina. Sabrina Sabrina Sabrina.. you see her run.

name: Gregory A. Meadows
text: Tried to charge me for everything but what the problem was. I apologise, it was the Bessemer Rd location

name: Michelle Cranor (FunSiZe)
text: Besides the wait time the customer service is great. I came in when they opened and had a appointment but it took them an hour just to get to my car. Sucks for me I will be late for work. So making a appointment doesn't always work. Besides that they are very friendly and helpful.

name: Margaret Strickland
text: When it came time to purchase new tires or our vehicles, I did a lot research and got a number of comparable quotes.  Firestone easily beat every quote.   On the service side, it's been a big disappointment.  Tried to sell me a new air filter when the one in the car was only 2 weeks old.  Tried to sell me an alignment with no explanation.  When I asked to see the numbers one wheel was so slightly off that I really beleive it could be calibration error as the old tires showed no signs of uneven wear and the car never pulled.  Today I went in for an apppointment at 9:00 am.  Every bay was full and I was told they were "down 3 techs".  Took 2 hr and 15 min for rotate and balance and oil change.  I specifically asked twice to include the full size spare in the rotation.  Left only to see it was not done.  Incidently, it's running the same air filter as on last visit and today it was "fine".  They also did not mention an issue with the suspension they said was problematic before.  So if today they were really busy and everything was "fine", and last time they were not as busy and they offered multiple unnecessary services, makes me wonder about how much pressure they get to "sell" services OR if, when they are busy, they don't do a thorough inspection.  Either way, it's disappointing.

name: Kelly Pan
text: Will charge you $60 to change 1 head light and will tell you it takes an hour. The actual cost of a headlight bulb is about $6 for a Toyota Corolla and it takes a LITERAL 1 minute to change the bulb. GO TO AUTO ZONE BUY THE BULB YOURSELF. THE AUTO ZONE WORKERS WILL CHANGE YOUR BULB FOR YOU FOR FREE.

name: Sidney Garner
text: Got tires from here 2 months ago, the day after I got them one was flat. Took it back they replaced it and now a month and a half later another tire is slowly going flat, took it in to ask if they could look at it and made me wait all afternoon. I would not recommend them.

name: DeJuana McCary
text: Karen the sales advisor and Michael the technician were excellent. People to be trusted, who care about you and your vehicle.

name: Phrawsty Gamez
text: Recently spent $500 for full service only to have my car cut out on me twice in the same day. FULL SERVICE BUT IT WAS BARELY A QUART OF OIL IN IT AFTERWARDS!!

resp.text: We are truly sorry to hear that you had a negative experience while visiting our Birmingham store. We would like to hear more details concerning this oil change service. Please, email us at, socialcare@bfrc.com, with a description of your visit, your contact information, and the invoice number or store address. We hope you will give Firestone a chance to rectify this issue.^Kristyn

name: Corinthean Mitchell
text: The technicians were very friendly and keep me informed of what was happening with my car.

name: Hank Winks
text:
Had tires installed on both trucks, both vehicles had tire pressure fault lights go off within a few miles of leaving the store.

Took them back, the store manager assured me they did nothing wrong. I told her the lights weren’t on in either truck previously, she said I was lying as her master certified mechanic saw the light on prior to changing the tires.

Never experienced anything like that before.

Very frustrating to be told I’m a liar and have the lights going off constantly to remind me of it...

resp.text: Hi Hank, we are sorry to hear about the negative experience you had at our Birmingham location. If you could email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with your contact information, invoice number, and a link to this review, we will escalate your concerns to our upper management team. We look forward to hearing from you. ^Miguel

name: Gregory W.
text: Speedy service plus thorough inspections equals quality business!

name: Chad Williams
text: Always Friendly but sometimes it takes a while because they stay busy.

name: April Quarles
text: They were really  nice when I  asked them a question.

name: Brad Treider

name: Bree k
text: My daughters car wouldn't start and she asked them if they could do a diagnostic and the man working there said no. He believed it was the antitheft system malfunctioning. So we thought maybe he knows what he's talking about. My husband worked on it and there is a bigger problem than the antitheft system and still the man would not run a diagnostic on the car. We bought parts there and still he wouldn't run the diagnostic test for us. He was practically laughing at my teenage daughter the whole time she struggled in the cold. We will never use this business and always use auto zone every time.

text: Almost everything i buy has a limited lifetime warranty. Best auto parts store imo

name: Adam Benson
text: To bree k. On your story about what took place. The vehicle in question was brought in because the ignition switch was defective. Due to the connector going to the anti-theft module was not making connection. After I spent 30 minutes on the phone with the chevy dealer I found the connector was not available. I instructed your daughter to go and get a complete unit with a new pig tail. After explaining to them that a code reading would bring no results to identify the issue. I did allow the vehicle to sit in my parking lot until the problem could be addressed. Most places charge several hundred dollars to do this. Several days later they brought in a switch from a junk yard that was ripped out and badly damaged. I told them they could not use part due to being damaged. After a couple days a night time worker offered to help with diagnostics, he brought his scan tool and tried to diagnosis the issue. Found the anti-theft module was not making any connection with the vehicles pcm. He spent over an hour trying to help your daughter for free. He normally charges $70 an hour for this. We have gone out of our way to help your daughter every way we could. Including letting the vehicle sit for over a week. No way did your stand out in the cold while we laughed at her. If you feel we miss treated you I am the store manager my name is Adam Benson and feel free to come by and we can discuss this situation.

text: Went in to get a replacement antenna for my car March 3rd 2021! When I went to check out the guy at the register was talking to a guy who just walked in and asked where the wheel covers were and he walked over a showed him! Instead of coming back to check me out he stood there talking when I ask him to check me out he ignored me and kept talking. This guy looked like a school kid and was very rude! I will not be going to the Sylacauga store again! I'll go to Cbu e.g. or take my business to another parts store!

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, David. We'd appreciate it if you emailed us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience and get back on track. We want to make sure all of our customers feel welcome and valued at our store, and it seems like we let you down. We hope you give us another chance to provide a great customer experience.

name: Rachel Lee
text:
Gave an extra start because whoever answered the phone had the decency to accept fault for an issue, and was polite.

Placed order online, and received an email that the order is ready for pickup. So, I drove from C'burg (past the AutoZone that said they are out of stock online) to Sylacauga, only to be told that the parts I ordered were not in stock, despite the notification that they WERE in stock.

Rather than calling me and letting me know, they issued a refund. Refund will take 3 to 5 business days to hit my card. I'm down to a couple dollars in the bank, I used my last bit of money for parts to fix a car for work.

Had they actually called me and let me know it's not in stock and not to make the drive, I would have requested they order the parts and I'd come pick them up tomorrow. But now, I'm broke for the next week. I can't even order the parts.

Please, PLEASE Autozone, next time this happens to someone, call them IMMEDIATELY and let them know, and ask them if they'd prefer a refund or to order the parts. Your customer should decide what should be done with their money.

resp.text: We're sorry for the inconvenience, Rachel. Professionalism is a priority for us, so we're sorry we weren't able to let you know. We strive to keep our stores well-stocked with a wide selection of products to support your automotive needs and get you back on the road. We're continuously improving and we hope you check us out again.

name: Austin Boston
text: Worst experience I’ve ever had in my life!! To begin with the Hoover store gave us the completely wrong part. We stop at the store in Calera to get the correct part. The manager Derrick was snarky and rude. Told us we bought “cheap brakes” and needed to buy the $64 ones instead. Then I try to just try to return. There was a customer in front of me taking a while and offered to let me go ahead. The worker refused. Then when it was my turn, I tried to return the brakes. The worker spent time trying to look up the part just to reiterate that it was the wrong part. I told him I wasn’t even purchasing new brakes, just returning those. I told him at least 10 times I bought it from Hoover. 5 minutes later he refused to return the wrong part because I didn’t purchase it at his store and stated “I wish you told me that sooner”. Too bad you can’t give a 0 Star review.

Service like this is why I stopped using Advanced several years ago.  So no,  I'm not impressed with the calera location.  The birmingham guys were great. The battery won't take a full charge,  the calera employee keeps trying to blame my battery charger.
