text:
I would not recommend this store to my worst enemy.  I am from out of town and I had my brake lights malfunction.  I stopped at this store to see if they could help me out and what I got was NOTHING.  I didn't expect them to fix it or even look at it.  I just needed some direction and what I got was a "we can't help you".  I went down the street to NAPA auto parts where the guy working in there checked my fuse for me and replaced it for me.  Advance needs to take some customer service lessons from NAPA.
I very rarely write negative reviews for retail businesses because I worked in retail management for years and I understand that things happen but this was beyond rude and I will always use NAPA going forward.

name: Matt Bryson
text:
I went to get my battery recharged or replaced. I pulled up and waited 10 minutes and then was waived off by the only employee in the bay working.

After someone finally came out to check, they said that my 5-year warranty on my battery was actually only good for 3 years and then they give your a credit towards a new battery for whatever is left of the last 2 years. I get it if that was the policy, but just very crummy that it wasn’t explained that way when I purchased and false advertising on the battery as it explicitly says “5-year Warranty”. Luckily the battery could be recharged after an hour.

name: Vanessa Kynes
text: Unfortunately, after an oil change here, I had a continuous oil leak. We finally discovered what the issue was and it required a mechanic and new part to repair. The mechanic mentioned it was from over tightening parts (cracked the oil sending unit) during the oil chance (since we didn't have the oil leak before).

text: I wanted to pick up what I needed and it was quick and easy to go through the auto service center and the staff was very helpful.

text: I went there for a simple oil change and a tire rotation and now my car is making the worst noise I’ve ever heard and they say they can’t do anything about it. ALRIGHT LOL

name: Kenneth Kendrick
text: great customer service quick and efficient  friendly

name: Stacy Beardslee
text: My tire light went on literally 2 minutes before pulling in to this ACC. I had driven through an accident 10 minutes before and knew this had meant that I had run over something. I live an hour away and wanted to find out if there was anything they could help me with it, I knew it was close to closing (about 15 minutes till) but my child was in the car and I wanted to make sure we'd make it back home safely. I tried to explain this to the man out in the shop (I was approached before I could even get out of the car) but he kept interrupting me stating that they were closing and trying to finish up on the car they were currently working on. All I wanted at the least was someone with a little knowledge to look at my tire and give me a recommendation/ opinion as to what my options would be. I understand that everyone wants to go home when their scheduled to, but come on! I just wanted to make sure I could make it home with my child safely!

name: Nelson Henderson
text:
Had battery for 5 years and today was the day to install a new one.
Randle greeted me very friendly and got work order started and tech installed battery very fast.
Walmart Automotive did great good getting me in and out.

name: Marcus Ross
text: Awful customer service. Very disrespectful. Extremely unorganized staff. Wish I could give them no stars. I called and asked for 2 tires for my car, they gave me the total price for both being installed for $155.16 before taxes. I told them let's do it and to order the tires. They called me back a few hours later telling me the tires were in. I drove 30 minutes down 280 for the tires. I pulled up and they told me they would get me right in and taken cared of. I went inside for a few minutes and saw my car was up on the lift, I waited for about 15-20 minutes and noticed my car was out of the shop, so I asked them if it was finished, and waited and waited and waited, and after talking to three different people it turned out they didn't do anything to the car at all. They just pulled it into the shop lifted it up, and then lowered it and pulled it out, and never relayed the information about why they did this. When I finally got someone to talk to the guys, they said that they didn't have the tires I ordered, and I told them that they had called me and told me they did and that I have a voicemail from them stating that they did, and I played the voicemail for them, and then talked to the guy directly that left me the voicemail. So, they go and look and turns out they do have the tires after all. They pull my car back in and put the tires on, then ring me up for $211.00, and I'm like, "I'm not paying that", then I have to talk to the manager that's "running" the shop, and finally after 3 hours I get the price they told me, thank goodness I had the voicemail from them for proof, and I got out. Never. Going. Back. Maybe the most unprofessional atmosphere and experience I've ever had with a business. Truly disappointing in every way. They were also very rude to the other customers that were waiting patiently as well. They would blatantly ignore you when you'd approach them with a question about your vehicle or the situation they were putting you in. Just straight up walk past you and not say a word to you or look you in the eyes. If and when they finally did talk to you, they just mumbled their words and you couldn't understand a thing they were saying. They need to clean house, get rid of the manager and all. If not that, then just do the entire state of Alabama a favor and close up shop completely, because you're not doing any good for anyone. Like, you're not even doing your jobs, like at all. Since I left, I've actually been wondering "what's even the point of this shop"? The guys are all just hanging out. Finally the guy that did put the tires on my car was just some dude, that wasn't even in a uniform like the rest of the automotive crew was. He was just in some shirt and ball cap with sun glasses, so I'd at least like to thank the random guy that probably doesn't even work there that actually did the work. Maybe he was an angel or something....? If it turns out he is an actual angel and it's some kind of real miracle, it's still not worth going back for.

I take my car there every time I need a oil change where my tires changed and they always provide me with good work and  customer service. one time my husband took my car up there and they did something wrong I don't know what it was but he took it back and they fixed it.

text: I have had them change my oil on my car  Excellent  job very friendly

name: Macey Franklin
text: The price is the best you can find... But you get what you pay for. The staff is very inefficient. There is usually about one car in the bay and they will tell you it’s going to be an hour and a half.  If you don’t mind wasting your time in saving the money I guess it’s worth it.

name: Mike Hiatt
text: Real rude service. Will definitely not be going back.

name: Wil Johnson
text:
Horrible staff.
Manager was nice but guys working it stink. Was told they would get me in as long as I got there before 7:00pm and I got there at 6:45pm. They close at 8. I drove 20 minutes on a spare tire only to have them rudely just repeat themselves saying “we’re closed” “we’re closed”. Wouldn’t even listen to me trying to explain my situation and that they told me on the phone they would service me if I got there before 7. He just walked off while I was talking and I had to follow him inside. Only once I asked to speak to the manager did he explain it was because they were full and wouldn’t finish before 8. I asked them to please help me out as my wife had to get to work tomorrow and my spare tire was going flat. They were no help so I went to NTB tires down the street and they quickly took care of me. Walmart you lost a customer from your horrible service. I had always previously used you, but no longer.

text: I had an appointment for 2 to put new tires on. They didn't even start to take the old tires off until 3pm. When I asked why they were getting started so late, the cashier said "oh you had an appointment?". I was not told about a mandatory lifetime balance charge per tire until I was being checked out.

name: clifton dawson
text: Great little parts store

name: vincenzo ceccarelli
text:
High quality work, fair prices, and excellent service. My wife and I are new to town and found Superior Auto Care on Google. I have two separate experiences to share.

1. After completing our move from Washington state, Philip got us right in to look at the brakes on my wife’s Subaru and do an oil change.  He had his techs do a thorough inspection only to find that the brakes were good and just a little squeaky. The labor cost was marginal and totally worth it for the peace of mind. The oil change was also very reasonably priced.
2. Brought the Subaru back in to have the AC serviced. Once again everything was working as it should be so Philip threw me the keys and sent me on my way free of charge.

Honesty and integrity go a long way with me. Philip has both of those qualities and will have my business for as long as his shop is open. If you’re on the fence about where to take your ride, Philip at Superior Auto Care is your guy.

name: John Whitaker
text: A/C not cooling as it should. A national oil change chain business told me the A/C compressor had to be replaced, approximately $800, or           $ 1400 with a warranty. I searched here and found Superior Auto Care. Problem resolved (replaced low Freon). I couldn't be more pleased with their honest and friendly service. They have all my auto repair business from now on. I'm not saying the national business tried to rip me off, they may have just been incompetent.

name: Bill Stratman
text: The mechanic is fantastic. They replaced my engine and did it right the first time. No loose bolts or missing parts. Everything was done right. Very thorough.

name: Gideon Rah
text: Deserves five stars. Friendly help. Goes above and beyond.

name: Haley Wood
text:
Truly top notch service and has my business forward. Now let me tell a story.....

My wife’s car was giving vibrations by my own accord and felt by the look of things, balancing would fix the issue. She was due new tires but I had a month or so before committing to new set. The tires had whooped out on the back two, but good tread even in the low spot and could not be balanced.  Still safe just rough riding by my account. Ordered tires, set up an appointment with a different tire shop on Saturday,  loaded up the new tires in her car. Saturday appointment was not booked (I can’t get it done) so I figure I would set up an appointment with another local shop close to work for Tuesday.

Monday...

My wife calls me at 9 am with a blowed out tire. She already late. And she already told me them tires got to be changed before today.

(Disclaimer.:  Her car came with no spare and I had been inactively looking for one).

So I’m deep in the dog house if you didn’t read between the lines.

She gets a tow to Superior Auto Care and they get after it in due time. Not unreasonable for a spur of the moment and professionally put those new tires on I already had in the truck.(I double checked and correct torque and the exact psi to spec and not “normal” like most shops I have dealt with)

The question I had all morning..... was it my misjudgment and my wife is mad forever or was it a nail that even new tires could not prevent?

By all evidence from Superior Auto Care, it was a screw.  True detectives they are and me and my wife had a great week.

It was just a flat not a blow out by the pictures. she had. Her safety even by my own misjudgment would not have been compromised. But I’m glad it was a screws fault and not my misjudgment.

Great guys over there. Phillip was more than helpful. Couldn’t ask for better service in this situation by my wife’s accord.

She got to work late, held it over my head while I didn’t know if it was my fault. I committed to a lot of things I would do this week I had been putting off not knowing it was not my fault.  But, I’m sitting here a happy man. Walked the dog while having conversations with my wife. Deep stuff that could have went the other direction. That is if it hadn’t been for the folks at Superior Auto Care making the correct diagnosis for the problem.

name: Jacob “Jake” Lamberson
text: They do good work for a fair price.

name: I Moss
text: I got a flat going to work. I called AAA who recommended Superior Auto. Phillip answered the phone and got me in with no warning. my car was ready when I got off work. I ended up replacing all my tires and my back brakes and rotors. They didn't try to upsell me but since i had been told at my oil change that the time was coming soon they verified and replaced it while there.

name: Nichole Winters
text: They really are superior! Customer service,  detailed work, timely, and affordable. I would go back for all of my car needs, if I didn't love out of town.

name: Kay H
text: Exceptional service. Was pleasantly greeted as soon as I entered the door. The owner took his time and addressed my  questions patiently. The mechanic was just as friendly. They made sure I was satisfied with the completed work and didn't overcharge me or upsell parts. I would highly recommend this shop.

One of the few places I've gone and got honest feedback on my vehicle.
Very reasonable prices.
Philip is awesome!

Excellent customer service
Great work to my car and repaired my car in great time frame
Nothing but good things to say I would recommend to anyone looking for auto care or repair

text: Great work but I spent more than I wanted. The cheap fix wasnt the fix... of course. I wished they would have followed up with me more and explained in detail the work. You spend $1400 I feel you should feel better about the work that was done.

resp.text: Sorry you feel that way Ray.  Please come by and discuss this further with us.   We will make it right!

text: I hesitate to give these guys 5 stars..... Only because of how great they are, i want them to stay a secret of Madison;) truly the nicest mechanic shop I've encountered in Alabama. Recommended👍

The work was very well done and they even fixed a couple other minor things I was not aware of that was needed. They were both very patient with me when I inquired about the extra repairs. I am way out of my element when it comes to cars and it was nice to feel like these guys understood my concerns and lack of experience. Good people.

text: The best auto care I’ve ever had... honest and good pricing. If you want something done right it’s this place. It’s worth the trip from Nashville

text: Phillip was very nice and worked with my wife and I without question on the solution and our budget. I highly recommend them.

name: Paul Rainwater
text: They have always done the work they said they would do at fair price. I would recommend anyone to go there and get their car fixed.

name: Brighton Pollard
text: Fantastic Staff! Prices are reasonable and repairs are quick! Always a pleasure to do business with this company. Highly recommend.

name: righttospeech Flydown
text:
I was taking a cross country road trip and my AC began coming out warm. Since I was unfamiliar with the repair shops in the area I turned to the google reviews that were favorable. They got this one right! The place is nothing fancy but they fixed my issue at a very fair price and had me in and out in about a hour. What I also like about the place was that they were very polite over the phone and friendly at the shop. In addition they did not do a sell job on me to make extra money as many shops do. If I lived in the area this would be my go to mechanic.
Thank you for your service.

name: Stephen Trumbull
text: They do good work and more importantly are honest. I brought my car in for an alignment. They called and said the alignment was not the issue, a bald tire was. They could have easily added the tire to the alignment and charged me for both.

name: Chris Plott
text: Philip was super nice and kept us in the loop about our car repair. They were fast and getting our car back to us.

name: Cory Anderson
text:
Outstanding staff. I've used these guys on three occasions with three different vehicles and have been very satisfied each time.

If you're looking for a mechanic in Madison I highly recommend these guys.

name: Junior Suan
text: From my experience, these guys strive to resolve issues on your vehicle. I had the pleasure of working with both co-founders & although we did not resolve issue, being they do not go deep as far as cam phasers, I can honestly say I left feeling relieved. They were very honest. They pointed me in the right direction on issue I was having so that was highly useful. I have numerous folks who have had successful business encounters with these fellas. Definently dependable, highly trustworthy.

name: Lanny Moore
text: Its Good

name: Jason Tynes
text: Been using this shop for 7 years. HONEST mechanics. And good. Highly recommended.

name: Carlos Bryant
text: Great guys. Good experience. I brought them a ghost of a problem and they somehow worked it out. Very fair. And nothing beats integrity. I usually do all the work on my vehicles, but if I ever need a pro, these are the guys.

name: Elizabeth Tanner
text: I dropped my car off overnight and left the note stating I needed an oil change and wanted them to look at brakes. They called the next morning saying they changed my brakes and when they tried to even out the rotors they weren't able to do it. They never even called to tell me I needed new brakes first so I was forced into this service and their prices. I wasn't thrilled by the lack of communication but honestly I needed brakes so it didn't matter. I told him I'd be there before they closed and asked him to call me if for some reason it wasn't ready and he said okay. I show up before they closed and he looked at me like I had 3 heads and said my car wouldn't be ready until the next day and that they were very busy and i should have called and checked (...which I did when he called about the brakes). I'm new to the area and didn't know anyone so I had been walking to/from there in 100 degree weather. The lack of communication was very frustrating. The man did apologize and even offered to drive me home (which is why they get 2 stars) but I would not recommend this place for their lack of communication.

resp.text: Sorry for the miscommunication.  We hope to do better.   For those reading this - please call us before coming as things do happen that push completion dates/times out.  We can only try and we are here for our customers to help not hurt.

name: Ashley Fountaine
text: Polite but overly-expensive. $170 diagnostic and they still didn't know what was wrong with my car. They obviously think their tools are made of gold. ;)

name: Shane Knox
text: Do not use them!! I made an appointment (four days in advance), then it was three days more until they even looked at it. They misdiagnosed the problem three times, tried to get me to pay for work that did not need to be done, and charged me double what it should have cost for what they did do. The mechanic is incompetent and the owner is dishonest.

resp.text: Shane,  we are very sorry that you feel this way about the service we provided.   Please contact us as soon as possible to discuss where we can improve and the issues you bring up, where we might improve or resolve to your liking.  We are not here to get rich, but to help our customers.   Waiting to hear from you phone or come by as you are able.

name: Scott A
text: Great prices

name: Joseph Gooding
text: Honest, quality service every time.

name: Maryann Hockman
text: Need help just before closing, my car would not start.Great service

name: Tracy Swatfager
text: Great service

name: Alisha Black
text: Good service

name: Sean Jensen
text: This shop and the employees saved me over Memorial Day weekend. My trailer picked up a nail in one of the tires and obviously leaking air. Even though they were booked for the whole weekend they were able to squeeze me in to patch and plug my tire. This got me back on the road so I could get all the way back to Texas without missing work. I am very grateful for what they did for me, and the staff working extra to accommodate me. Very friendly and professional shop will recommend for anything you need.

name: Robert Burns
text: A welcome and much-needed addition to the Auburn Opelika area. Firestone has been there for us for years and has serviced all of our vehicles! Most definitely glad to have them in town!

name: Haley Sherman
text: Today was such a great experience! Earnest and Tiffany were SO KIND and patient with me. It was my first time buying new tires and they walked me through that process very well. They also made sure to check other aspects of my car to make sure it was safe when I left the store. I will FOR SURE be going back there. Good people. High quality work. What more could you ask for?

resp.text: Hi Haley, we appreciate the feedback so much. It's great hearing our services met your expectations! Thank you for stopping by our Firestone! ^Blake

name: Sandra Hull
text: I was driving home to ATL and my check engine light came on. I stopped in at Firestone and was well taken care of. Everyone here was kind, helpful and informative.  I truly felt like I was a priority as everyone here worked fast and efficient just so I could get back onto the road and make it home. Thank you again Tiffany and Earnest for your help!

name: Nate VanderWoude
text: I went in for an oil change on a Sunday, which is a walk-in only time. I fully understand that wait times are longer with a shorter staff, and no scheduled times. I got there at 1pm and was told that it wouldn't be done until 3-3:30. Again, it's a long wait, but I understand. At about 3, another customer comes in for a new battery. He is given an estimate that it will be about 5 when his vehicle is ready. At 3:45 both of our cars are taken to the back by the same technician. Again, this is already 15 minutes past my estimated completion time. My car is lifted, and the oil is drained. The tech then moved to the battery change, and worked there until it was completed at 4:15. He then disappeared, then came back and finished my oil change at 4:45. Again, I am a reasonable customer, but having another customer moved in front of me for no reason, causing me to wait for nearly 4 hours is absolutely unacceptable. I won't be going back.

name: Jared Stauffer
text: I came in at 4:55 on Sunday with a nail in my tire. I was on my way back from Auburn and heading the whole way to South Carolina. I didn’t realize I had a nail until I was on the road. Paul and his team were more than happy to help. Firestone closes at 5 pm on Sunday, but they stayed late just to help patch my tire. Super grateful for them. Will be coming back to Firestone in the future!!

name: T Potts
text: Pretty clean shop area. Usually quite busy. Appointment recommended. They've done quite a few repairs on my old pickup truck and so far I'm well pleased with results.

name: Joshua Jones
text: When their competitors were having a day off, the good people at Firestone saved the day by not only having the scarce tire I was looking for, but was able toput it on the very same day!

name: Chicky The Awesome
text: I love Tiffany the manager. We were there getting tires but they also let us know our battery was low. Excellent service. Paid for 4 new tires and a lifetime warranty alignment cheaper here than three other places that I called for a quote. They have my business from here on out. Great folks and excellent service and quality maintenance.

name: Alisha Walker
text: I went in for a oil change, and the next day my oil light came on. I called and someone told me they probably didn’t put enough oil in it.. a month later my car started making noise because I didn’t have anyone oil at all. They never game me a sticker in the left corner to let me know when I should get another one. Wouldn’t recommend when it comes to the an oil change!!!

name: Michael Easterwood
text: Very nice people working here. I highly recommend this place.

name: James Acord
text: My family and I have been long term Firestone customer. We’ve been to countless Firestones and I can reassure you this one is the best of them all. There is a common denominator and that is the supervisor Tiffany Stevens. She goes completely above and beyond to service her customers and treat them right. If there was a definition of perfect customer service she meets & exceeds those expectations. She was previously at the Fort Benning Firestone that my father goes to and she was phenomenal there. Her leadership at this firestone proves to build the brand and cement our trust in the company. I honestly can’t thank her enough for how kind and helpful she has been to us - She truly deserves infinite praise & recognition for her hard work.

name: Michael Brown
text: Good customer service they explain everything clearly

name: Patrick strickland
text: Very friendly staff did alignment and was quick and very nice. Tiffany was very helpful.

name: Jonathan Keaton
text: Scratched all four of my wife’s rims on her Tahoe and the manager Tiffany said get a quote and they would fix it. Got a quote and she said it was to high so went and got another quote and she said it was turned over to corporate. They absolutely will not pay for there mistakes and make it right with the customer. Never dealt with anything like it in my life. Terrible!!!

resp.text: Hello Jonathan, we are sorry to hear of this issue after service at our Opelika store. We would like to investigate your concerns, please, send us an email to, socialcare@bfrc.com. We will need full details, your contact information, and your invoice number. Thank you for choosing Firestone, we value your business. ^Kristyn

name: Tim Hornsby
text: Recently, my daughter was Traveling from Auburn back to Atlanta.  Before leaving she discovered that one of her tires was very low on Air.  I called Firestone Opelika, AL, since they were the only store open on Sunday.  Paul answered the phone and said he'd be able to look at the tire but wasn't sure he'd have time to fix it since it was almost closing.  The tire had a nail and was not repairable.  Paul worked overtime to make the car safe for my daughter so she could get back home.  Firestone, thank you for caring and providing incredible service.  Next time I'm calling Firestone first.

name: Stephanie S
text: Employee's are nice but when you have an appointment there really slow.

name: K Verb
text: Wow, these guys are the best auto service ever. Shredded two high load trailer tires on the freeway on a Saturday before Father's Day, two hours before closing. They had me in and out in 30 minutes for each tire. Did I mention I had to come back for the second tire? They fit me in between other jobs and got me back on the interstate; kept me from being stranded in town on Father's Day weekend. All was with a smile and a great attitude of, we will get you fixed and on your way, don't worry.

name: Shikera B.
text: A huge thank you to Tiffany for making sure my two day process was completed and my car was taken care of. A company MUST go above and beyond to receive FIVE STARS on any review I complete... Ms. B, a satisfied, loyal customer.

name: edwina halliday
text: Great place. Nicest and caring staff. They didn't think they were able to fix my truck even good enough for the 200 miles I needed to get back home. But they did a wonderful job. The truck levelled out the closer to home I got the better the truck ran.

name: Bettie Whyte
text: A huge thank you to Tiffany for making sure my two day process was completed and my car was taken care of. A company MUST go above and beyond to receive FIVE STARS on any review I complete... Ms. Blakely a satisfied loyal customer.

name: Danny Hale
text: Good people , good service !

name: Deborah Hodges
text: Great service..We had car trouble while traveling through. They were great. Got us back on the road in a very timely manner.

name: Edward Dellascio
text: Fast and courteous

name: Judith Goggans
text: Had a flat tire on the interstate during a very rainy evening minutes away from business. I called to find out how to get to them the quickest because I knew it was closing time according to their website. They got me in and out in a hurry, I ended up having to buy a new tire but it was worth them waiting until I got there to see if they could patch the other tire.

resp.text: Judith, we're so glad that you chose us for your automotive needs. Now, you're a part of the Firestone family! ^Alexis

name: Arturo Vegas
text: We came here in an emergency after finding a slow leak in one of our tires. They were extremely courteous and fast. My overall stay was about an hour or less. Also the place inside was clean and they have a TV for your wait time or there are some shops within walking distance for that too. The parking was not bad and bathroom was clean. Very pleased with the service here.

name: S. S. C.
text: I took my suv there for a tire that they did not have they said they would have the tire the next day so two days later I went to another tire shop and they replaced it the same day save yourself a headache and go somewhere else

resp.text: Hello. We can only imagine how frustrating this was for you, and we apologize. We'd be happy to escalate your concerns to the appropriate management team. Please, feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with these details of your visit, the store location, any related invoice numbers, and your contact information. We appreciate your business with Firestone, and we look forward to your message. ^Mariah

name: Heather Randolph
text: Very friendly and helpful.

name: crdubalyah
text: Super helpful staff. Got my alignment just right and done quickly too!

resp.text: crdubalyah, thank you for choosing Firestone! We look forward to your next visit. ^Jennifer

name: Trayvis Minnifield
text: Great very Great

name: Brittany B Lipscomb
text: Honestly, this review is long overdue. First of all, I never thought a place like this could provide great customer service. But I'm glad that I was wrong. Jim is one of the best mechanics. It is awesome that I can call him and he will literally take time to help me figure out what is going on with my car when I'm2 hours away. He also drove me to work when I was dropping my car off so I didn't have to walk in the cold to work while being sick. He also was willing to drive to Atlanta while my car was having mechanic issues but thankfully, I was able to drive home with his help. I'm not sure what I can say to make you understand that all the amazing guys who work here genuinely care about you. The best part about this place that I frequently visit is that they love my 78 lb dog Waffle and are great about him visiting when the car needs work. They often ask about him if he is not with me. My first encounter with Firestone was with Brandon but since he left, I love the whole team. Thanks Firestone for taking care of me, I am so glad that you are serving Opelika with amazing customer service. I really am grateful to y'all!!

name: Rick Richards
text: I'm pretty cynical about most repair shops, but the folks at your store are just outstanding.  They could not have been more helpful, kind and knowledgeable.  You've got a great team and thanks again

name: JSS Development and JS Management
text: I went there with four new tires I bought off the web For a lot less than they wanted for tires and they said they could not change them that day they were very rude this is my first and last experience at this place

name: Sanghoon Hong
text:
Had my summer tires mounted and aligned a few days ago here. This weekend, I was doing some maintenance on the car in the garage which required me to take the wheels off and oh my did Firestone over torque the lug bolts to hell.
The spec for my BMW is around 103 lbs-ft for the bolts and so usually I'll just pop it off with my impact wrench and go on with my day. My impact wrench wasn't loosening the bolts. OK, maybe it's dying. So I got my breaker bar out and had the back workout of my life. One of the bolts, I had to stand and jump on the breaker bar to loosen it....come on guys, I don't even want to think about what that was torqued to...
Yall made me think my trusty impact wrench was failing me
And they charged me for tire disposal, even though I took the all-season tires that was taken off back with me... but thats a story for another time.

resp.text: Hello Sanghoon, we are sorry to hear about this issue after tire service and would be happy to help. Please, send us an email to, socialcare@bfrc.com, with full details, your contact information, and the store's full address. You are a valued Firestone customer, and we hope to hear from you soon. ^Kristyn

name: grady simpson
text: Paul was awesome. Needed air in the tires of an RV we had just purchased. Paul, who I assumed was the service manager, said sure and personally came out and aired the tires up. It's hard to find customer service like that nowadays. Oh, it was also 5 minutes before closing and no charge.

name: Michael Waldrep
text: Was not satisfied with service and neither was lady customer in line ahead of me,she was complaining also.

resp.text: Michael, we appreciate you bringing this to our attention. This is not the type of service that we expect our loyal customers to receive, and we truly apologize. Please feel welcome to email us at socialcare@bfrc.com with the details of your visit, the store, and your contact information. We value your business, and we thank you for contacting Firestone. ^Jennifer

name: Expert Reviewer
text:
Went to avail myself of my lifetime alignment that I bought and have not used. They told me it would be an hour and they would call when it was ready, so I walked to Lowe's to shop. After several hours and no phone call, I called and was told we cannot touch your car because it is a liability if we do because there is metal showing through and you have to buy tires or we cannot let you go. Started to buy the tires and then realized that the tires had a warranty because they were not that old. So I call and tell them to cancel putting new tires on it. I take it to get the Goodyear warranty honored. Then find out there is NOT any metal showing through the tires and the tires still have mileage. They flat out lied!

I will NEVER buy any products from them ever. I don't care if they are selling tires for half the price of other stores.

name: carina santiago
text: Life savers!! Great service and friendly staff!

name: carina santiago
text: Life savers!! Great service and friendly staff!

name: Aubieone
text: They’ve done front brakes and a TPMS sensor on my truck and a blend door actuator on my SUV. All work was great and was done in a timely manner. My “Only” gripe is I don’t believe they should be charging $10-$20 for diagnostic if they perform the work.. most places drop that charge if the work is performed otherwise I’d give 5 stars. Please consider that Firestone.

name: william phillips
text: Quick and professional!

name: Kevin McSpadden
text: I wanted to get the battery checked out on my daughter's car that we recently bought along with an alignment check (due to me recently placing struts on her car) and the tires re-balanced(they did not balance them correctly a couple of weeks ago, car still shaking in rear at certain speeds). Tires still out of balance and was misled on what was wrong with the battery.  Store Manager, Tiffany Stevens, would not even acknowledge me when I asked her if I could speak to her.  She didn't act like she even cared at all.  Techs get paid by the job and by how much labor is, keep that in mind if you do not take heed to this review.

name: Mannus Foster
text: Good people and service

name: Tabitha Prestridge
text: Very friendly and great service

name: Dennis Moore
text: Just needed air in my tires. Very friendly person at counter.

name: Kimberly W
text: I am so excited to finally have a Firestone in Opelika! The staff was very friendly and cheerful.  The service advisor did not try to pressure me into having service done.  He stated what was needed at the time and did not press for anything additional, I appreciate that.  Very friendly atmosphere.

name: A E
text: I was satisfied with my scope of service, oil change, nail in tire, honored my coupon.  Thanks guys!!

name: Amanda Holloway
text: I have an 09 Honda Civic and I took it to this location because my a/c went out and I have always heard good things about Firestone.I dropped my car off so they could diagnosis the problem and was called about an hour later stating that my a/c compressor went out due to old age and it would be $1296.00 to fix. I went and picked my car up and refused the recommended work. Luckily, I went and got a second opinion from a local mechanic who immediately stated that it was more then likely just the A/C relay switch. And after about 30 minutes my a/c was fixed and it only cost me $50.00. Not sure why Firestone would try to charge me for something that was not broken. I will never recommend this location to anyone because I feel they tried to rip me off.

name: Carl Crawford
text: Good service

name: A E
text: I was satisfied with my scope of service, oil change, nail in tire, honored my coupon.  Thanks guys!!

name: Tim Smith
text: Pleasant attitude and fast service today

resp.text: Tim, cars are our passion, but your are our priority. Thank you for choosing Firestone. ^Alexis

text: Fast service and they did my oil change 15 minutes before close! Other places turned me away 1hr before close saying they didn't have enough time to complete the work.

name: Andy Thee

text: My Back lights weren't  turning off when the car was parked. So A Neighbor recommended O'Riley Auto Parts. "Duke"  Provided A1 Customer Service, by Replacing the fuse, that was causing the problem! Thank You! 👍😄

text: Love the employees and they always have what I need !!! Absolutely love going here sometimes 6 times in one day 😂

name: jeremy barron
text: Great people and service. Only reason for 4 stars is they didn't have the O2 sensor I needed in stock when I went.

text: Did not have scanning tool for engine even though it is advertised in window no help at all did not even ask why i needed it i will shop elsewhere from now own

name: Sherri Lynn

name: Steve Sawicki
text: Wow! 10 stars! This store saved my vacation! KYLE provided outstanding service, guidance and friendly advice. He read my computer codes, researched cause, provided parts list, got all parts (1 out-of-stock), recommended needed tools and called other stores for last part. Found at cheaper $ and matched same lower price for the one he sold me! Incredible! He also gapped new plugs & provided a firing order diagram. Helped get a very rough running tow vehicle back to cruising while family enjoyed a local lunch! THANK YOU KYLE!! Surprised no prev reviews. This place was a true blessing of gracious hospitality!

text: Heading to NC with my travel trailer while traveling alone, Ken was a great help, friendly and courteous when i had to come from 65 N for oil pressure switch as my check engine light came on, Ken suggested  northside auto repair to install, they took me right in! Grateful Grateful 🙏🏼

text: I love this place, the workers are always friendly and never pushy. It's always spotless and we'll maintained. If you can't find it, they will always rush from behind the counter to walk you right to the product.

I would highly recommend this parts house to anyone that is needing parts for their automobile. And if you are needing the computer checked they will gladly check it with their machine at ni charge and print out their findings. And also help you with whatever problems found. Ive had them do that to both our vehicles and they fixed our problems so they are great. Just saying if you have problems give them a try

name: Aaron Ryals
text: I purchased a brand new vehicle from them April 29th. The service until the sell was made was nothing short of phenomenal. However, it ended there. It’s now been 5 weeks and they still haven’t sent my paperwork to my county for me to be able to purchase my tag. My wife and I have called multiple times and we get the same response. We will check and call you back. Guess what....no one ever calls back. I’m completely frustrated and have received warnings for no tag, so I now have a vehicle I can’t drive because I’m way beyond my 10 business days to have a tag. I recommend you shop somewhere else. I should have paid more and purchased local.

name: Mohammed ALKhateeb
text: Love the service,  love the cars and every one friendly!

name: tina morgan
text:
We purchased a renegade from Mikail. He was very helpful and made it a very easy purchase.
The entire staff also made us feel welcome which we’ve had bad experiences at other dealerships. We will definitely buy from them again! Thank you Mikail!

name: A. Mck80
text: My experience at Autonation was awesome. My service advisor was Jason Williams and he saw to it that I had awesome service. Not only did he greet me when I drove up to the service center, but he made sure I had beverages to drink, he checked in with frequently to keep me informed of the progress they were making on automobile, and he saw to it that I received the services I requested and I received them in a timely manner. He was absolutely awesome and I will come back again.

name: LaToya B
text: This place was the absolute worse place I ever been to for car repair service. They were very unprofessional. They lied to me and told me my services would be covered under warranty. They said they called and then told me later warranty was not covering. My car went into the shop running and was there for 3 weeks. When I tried to go get it now they are saying it needs a whole new motor. It was so many levels to this, but I would never in my life ever buy a Dodge and I will never go to that dealership again. Everyone that work there is a complete joke.

name: Christopher Peters
text: They have trouble wearing masks correctly. Also, the Service department treats customers like an after thought.

name: jan vickers
text: automation is awesome! they bought my vehicle and found the exact suv I wanted!! Alexis was so sweet, and oh so helpful!

name: Jackie Camp
text: When my 2014 Chrysler 200 needs service I take it to AutoNation because they are professional and they check everything to make sure no issues arise.  When it's going to be a long wait they come and let you know were they are on each step of repair.  They always have coffee and water if needed.  They also check on recall parts so you want have to come back they fix it doing your service visit.  They always offer other discounts on oil changes, tires and other necessities.  I wouldn't take my Chrysler anywhere else.

name: Matt Montenegro
text: Some of the most sleezy people that give all car sales men a bad name. Purchased a used vehicle from this dealership in May of 2020. I was sold when I was told that my vehicle had an Auto Nation warranty of "90 days or 4,000 miles." Sounds great doesn't it? Well after being hurried along in signing paperwork so the vehicle could be mine I was very happy with my purchase. However, less than a month later, and still well within my "warranty" coverage period I got a Christmas tree of lights on my dashboard. I was told to take it to its dealership and from there I could then make the claim. When I called to make the claim, Auto Nation's warranty service said there was no vehicle with my VIN in the system. I then called the manager there who told me, "I never signed any contract stating I had a warranty and it doesn't matter what I was told because it isn't in writing." I realized the manager was right about this however, I was being told one thing then they intentionally rushed me through signing paperwork so that I wouldn't catch that I never signed anything for my "warranty". The deceptive methods of these people shows that they are talented at one thing and, one thing only and, that is lying to people. These people are clearly slimy and cannot be trusted, save yourself the hassle and do not purchase a vehicle from here. Learn from my mistake, don't come here. Where ever you do go, whatever you are offered make sure it is in writing!!!!

name: William Mott
text: The two service advisors I usually deal with are Michael Robinson and Ken Baker; they are always friendly and helpful. I dropped off my truck for service (oil change, tire rotation, etc.) and Ken Baker called back to notify me that my vehicle was ready. As far I know, the work was done satisfactorily.

name: Charles Bailey
text: I’ve never had any problems with them. Good quality work on time. They’ll tell you if something else needs to be looked at.

name: Samantha Stefan
text: I have purchased 3 Vehicles from this Dealership with my Husband and have had the same salesman Austyn ! He is Humble and Honest and that means a lot these days when purchasing a vehicle. They met my expectations and we will continue to buy from here as long as he is there. The best experiences I have ever had at any Dealership and I have bought many vehicles in my lifetime!!! Thank you Austyn you Rock !!!

name: Alfonso Packer
text: Consumer service was very poor. Upon arrival to pick up my car after recall work I had to stand in the lobby for 20mins before I was even acknowledged to get help. Then the service guy who said he had my paper so he would him me continued a phone call for an additional 30 mins. It didn’t bother me until I heard the conversation, which seemed personal not AutoNation business related, so I decided to go to parts while I waited to get so things. That department was great. After finishing up he still was on phone so I went to someone else to see if I could be helped then he decided to pull up my paperwork and noticed it was a recall job and only need a signature and to hand me my keys. I will never probably use the service department if that was a example of the customer service to expect.

name: Richard Dodson
text: Had some warranty work done on my 2019 Ram 1500. Troy was very knowledgeable of what needed to be done, and the service technicians did a great with the small issues that had, andchad my truck ready to go in a timely manner. Great job Autonation team.

name: Ms. Kay
text: Great service team. Ken was extremely patient throughout the journey. I experienced some flood damage in September 2019 that required major repairs to include a rental for a few weeks. Updates were offered and a complete thorough summary of what was serviced. Ken and the team wereprofessional. My vehicle was as showroom ready as the day I purchased it from them. Roll Tide.

name: Daijha Doss
text: NONE of my experiences at autonation have been pleasant. I’m either here all day or have to leave my car for days at a time because they can’t seem to do their jobs. My car was there for 2 days just to get the battery changed (I kid you not). Now I’m waiting on a part for my car and dear lord you would think they had to actually build the part themselves. I’ve been told 3 different stories about this part. I’ve had my car for almost 4 years now and EVERY SINGLE TIME I’m in there someone is upset about how they run this place. Now I’m that someone. Thanks for nothing Autonation. Keep up the good work.

name: Rick McNeill
text: I have dealt with Tommy Johnson on multiple occasions and he has always been courteous and professional.

name: Amir Sahori
text: Very unprofessional staff. 7 hour oil change while I was stuck at the mall. No service or anyone to help get me anywhere. Was given a call 20 min before closing time and said that my ride was ready, got there 40 min later due to traffic and they said they closed. So honestly never doing business with this dealership ever again. I suggest everyone get oil changes at Honda rather than this dealership... buy your cars somewhere else, the bad service outweighs the quality of their trucks.

name: Samuel Alston IV
text: I was completely satisfied with the Service Advisor, Mike Robinson’s eagerness and prompt service to my problem. I definitely enjoyed the awesome service. I will recommend him to friends and colleagues. Also, Autonation as somewhere to go for all their car related needs.

name: Janet Wright
text:
Great company, great atmosphere, and it was awesome working with Chris and Austin
They made us feel at easy and comfortable
My husband and I would definitely do business with this company again
Thanks guys

name: Natalia Hornbuckle
text: Great experience from beginning to end!!! Salesman (Sondra) not overbearing, very professional, cordial and kind. Ralph in Finance great personality. Wonderful experience.

name: Scott Boyd
text: The staff there worked out a great deal for me on my purchase of a 2020 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Rubicon.

name: Dana Adcock
text: 10 years ago we bought a new Jeep Grand Cherokee.   No one has ever touched this car but Auto Nation.  A couple months age my husband took the car in for repair.  A new condenser had to be installed.  After the work was completed, when we picked the car up, the dash lights were out.   We were told there would be an additional $300 or more to fix it.  This was very shabby business as it was fine before the work was done.   I’ve had a couple of issues with this establishment but let it go but this is going to far to expect us to pay for something that was broken while a very expensive repair was being done on the car.

name: Daniel Eisrnhard
text: Sid was very helpful throughout the whole process of repairing my wife’s vehicle through the extended warranty.  He spent time on the phone dealing with my warranty company and when it came time he even drove me in his own vehicle to the rental company.

name: Diane Krause
text: I took my car in for repair of the power adjustment on the driver seat. The service rep who took care of me made the scheduling and check-in nice and easy and arranged for the shuttle service to take me home. I was disappointed that the AutoNation website didn't allow me to schedule an appointment for repairs online (only maintenance services could be done online). I got a diagnosis and repair quote within a day, but word that it would take a week to get the part in. It turned out to be an additional day for the part to arrive, and I was told the car would be done the following day, but  it took two more days for it to get done. We came from the Houston area where we were used to parts being accessible more quickly, so this wait time may be normal for the Mobile area. The pickup experience was a bit frustrating. I picked up on a Saturday and waited 1 hour 15 minutes to get checked out (was told the car was ready but paperwork had to be done). The service rep kept getting pulled away by walk-ins, phone calls, and I'm not sure what else, but it seemed I kept getting bumped to the back of the line. There may have been more legitimate reasons for the long wait time, but those weren't shared with me. Everyone was nice and helpful, and my car was repaired, but the wait times were a bit disappointing.

name: And P
text: Parts department is a joke. Spent 10 minutes going in circles trying to reach someone there. Eventually just hangup.

name: Cinde Pocase
text: I recently had a recall taken care of on my Jeep Renegade at Auto Nation Jeep in Mobile.  Troy took care of setting up my appointment and getting the repair done. They always do a great job there and take care of me and my car.

name: Darla Wheeler
text: Awesome experience!!! Austyn Long gave us great service. We are very happy with our purchase and will be going there if we need anything in the future.

name: Michael Harris
text: Service was good Michael was good at explaining what I needed. Not sure if I needed all of what I got,but overall I was satisfied.

name: Mr. A.D.
text: Ron did a awsome job getting me in and out fast. He also explained a lot of things I didn't know that I could get for my vehicle.

name: Clausell Huff
text: GREAT SERVICE VERY CLEAN QUALITY VALUE GREAT. THANK YOU

name: Will Powell
text: Shamarcus Mack did his job well as the salesman and was very helpful and friendly. I recommend him completely but AutoNation as a whole, not so much. I bought a car from there on August 26th. I paid cash and was told that I would have the paperwork for the title and so I could get my tag, in about 10 days but to allow 20. It’s weird to me that I didn’t get the title that day but now it has been a month and I still don’t have the paperwork. I’m still driving around with no tag, just the temp tag.

name: John Boy Gordon
text: I WORK THERE

name: Scott Ford
text: I drove about an hour away from home to sell my car to Autonation because they were willing to give me substantially more than other car buying services.  To be realistic the price was still under the book value for the vehicle, but no messing around, just a reliable sale.  I would say from the time I drove in to the time I left with a check was less than an hour and they gave me 50% more than what Carmax offered.  Karen in the online department was great to sit with while the service guys did a quick inspection and prepared the paperwork and check.  If you're looking to sell a vehicle and don't want to mess with CL or haggle with another dealer, autonation was great for me.

name: Tomecia Watts
text: I had the best experience ever. I went in to purchase one vehicle and walked out with 2 new vehicles. I'm very excited about my purchases and I would highly reccomend my salesperson Mykel. Charlie also made the experience  wonderful as well.

name: ADDIE LAWSON
text: I love this place!  I have a 2018 Jeep Wrangler and I took it in for service early in the morning.  I had questions on the transmission and they checked that too.  Wonderful service department!

name: Dwayne Bartley
text: Great service fast and reliable.  Wide selection of vehicles. Had to take a star off because they dont have the slushy machine no more. Bring it back.

text: The customer service is fantastic, I bought my car from there last year with the gold warranty & everything has been awesome. A++++

name: Mark Maxwell
text: The staff were great and answered all our questions. Our sales person, Austyyn, was professional, friendly and never pushy.  If you are looking for a vehicle, I would absolutely recommend AutoNation Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram Mobile.

Not sure if I'd give Autonation a thumbs up BUT I'd definitely give Mr. Cejka 2 thumbs up..

name: Jeremy Davis
text: AutoNation made buying my Jeep quick and easy! They take the pain and dread out of buying a vehicle. I would highly recommend them to anyone!

He managed to get me a 2017 Chevy Cruze when I was afraid I wasn't going to be approved for a car let alone a new one. Go to him with all your vehicle needs.

name: shandrekus wilson
text: These ppl sold me bad tire which caused my tire to shake..went back they said it wasn't my tire it was a front end alignment smh..took it toa mechanic shop and was put on a machine and it read that my tire had a belt broken on the INSIDE of the tire..now mind u..it was the day before when I got the tire put on..matter of fact spent 160for 4new tires..ALL OF THEM WAS NO GOOD..Never Again

name: Adam Lowery
text: Great service

name: Mercy the Buzzard
text: Nice fellow, but way more expensive than the others.

name: Fidel Walker
text: Quick and reasonable

name: William Carrithers
text: They do good work and fast too!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Dorothy Adams
text: I asked the young gentleman at the Counter if they helped replace headlight bulbs. He said depends on the car- so he came and checked it out. Help me find the bulb that was needed, replaced in no time! He had me check my high beams and low beams- said all four of headlights were working- (it took him a second) though to say that. (That should have been a red flag right then for me).Well I gave him a small tip for helping me out. I went to leave and looking at the lights shining on the door it did not look like all four were working but I had somewhere else to be and was already running behind. I said I would check it out when I got to my next stop- sure enough they were not working. I am mad at myself for not addressing it then! I called back the next morning and talked to the young man and he said “all four were working when you were here.” I explained how the minute he walked away- I didn’t think it was right but it’s my fault for not addressing it right then! I am supposed to stop by and see the manager today— so we shall see what the outcome is! Lesson learned for me!

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Dorothy. It is never our intent to deceive or mislead as we value all our customers. Please send us an email at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can make things right. We hope we can regain your trust and confidence.

name: David Grimes
text: Just called Madison Blvd location to let them know my limousine was coming in for a battery.  The lady that answered told me not to worry and they will install another.   Great customer service.  I don't remember her name.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback, David! We're happy to hear that our crew helped you out with installing your battery. We always want to make sure we're providing you with excellent customer service. Thanks for trusting AutoZone!

name: Dustin Pressler
text: Always helpful and knowledgeable. This location doesn't do commercial accounts though. Ended up spending $260.00 anyways.

resp.text: We always enjoy hearing from our customers, Dustin. We pride ourselves on our crew's excellent customer service and extensive product knowledge, so thank you for letting us know how we're doing. We'd appreciate it if you emailed us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience.

name: Sarah
text: Very helpful and nice staff. They told me about a deal when I was in need a windshield wipers and I got the gallon of windshield cleaner for a few cents. I love a good deal!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Sarah! We're happy we've got you covered. Our goal is to support all of our customers with the best product selection at the best prices. We hope you continue to trust AutoZone for all your automotive needs.

name: Lou Miller
text: Ready to help! Tested alternator and battery without hesitation. Very pleasant and personable!! Store is clean and well stocked...I recommend this store to all!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Lou! We're glad we helped you out with testing your alternator and battery. We want to make sure we are providing excellent service and the best selection of automotive products. We hope you check us out again soon!

name: Samual Thornton
text: The parts counter needs help. Been in there several times recently and had to wait forever to get help.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Samual. We want to make sure you can always count on us for an easy and seamless experience, so we're sorry we missed the mark. Please reach out to us at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can learn more about your experience.

name: manny washington
text: Poor service and quality. Will never return to auto zone!

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, Manny. We're sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience at our store. Customer service is a priority for us and we're always looking for ways to improve. We hope you visit us again so we can provide a better experience. Thank you for visiting AutoZone.

name: Louis S
text: Nice folks. Clean and new

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Louis! We're glad you had a great experience with us. We want to make sure we're providing excellent customer service and that our store is always well-organized. We hope you check us out again soon!

name: Kimberlee Mays
text: I went with a flat tire they made me leave to go get my paperwork, which was in my truck on the side of the road. Something so simple as looking up my member number. Then I came back to get my spare fixed and they didn’t even take the time to go look at my truck to see what I needed. Instead was trying to sell me a new tire rather than just listening. I got so frustrated I left and ended up just going to the one in Hoover. Which by the way is the best sam’s club in Birmingham. The customer service there is amazing. I will never come back to this tire center. The do not seek resolutions nor try to help you. The service is trash.

name: Matthew Bunt
text: Replaced 4 tires yesterday. Brought it back today because it was shaking on interstate. Arrived at 9:35.  They said I had to upgrade to a Plus membership since it was before 10 am.  I told them I'd wait. I asked for the manager, and then the clerk let me check it in but said it would still be an hour or more before they got to it.

name: Will Geiger
text: The person running the battery sales counter was unable to tell me which battery was the proper one for my car. “One is a little wider than the other one” isn’t a proper answer when I ask the difference between the two. Save your time and go to the Auto Zone at the corner of Green Springs and Valley Ave. Those folks were incredibly helpful.

name: Kayla Lewis
text:
This has been nothing but a disappointment. I went to Ford initially and they told me new tires would $1000. I thought “surely I can do better than that at Sam’s.”

Wrong. I may have gotten tire and install for $600, but these mechanics DID NOT KNOW AND DID NOT HAVE THE RESOURCES to take the two-piece locking lug nuts from my Ford. Here are the things that transpired:
1. First visit, didn’t have but one type of tire in the size I needed. I was told to go home and order some from the website. Great, that’s fine with me.
2. Tires purchased from website did not fit my car DESPITE me typing the year, make, and model of my car onto their tire bank. Told to order another set.
3. Order second set of tires from online, go to store to have them put on. I hang out in the store for THREE HOURS while they’re “replacing my tires.” I finally get fed up of waiting and ask why it’s taking so long, only to be told THEY HAVEN’T BEEN ABLE TO GET THE LUG NUTS OFF OF MY CAR. Why wasn’t I CALLED or PAGED while I sat in the store after 30 minutes of trying. I get told I need to purchase new lug nuts.
4. $100 and 20 lug nuts later I’m back at Sam’s. At this point I have already paid for the tires, install, and a complete set of lug nuts ($700). Once again I go sit on the patio furniture for what I suspect to be an hour while they replace tires. 1.5 hours later I’m starting to get concerned again. I go back to the tire center to see what’s up, and what do you know. One tire is off and they’re SCRATCHING THEIR HEADS AT THE LOCKING LUG NUTS AGAIN. The mechanic proceeds to tell me that I need to go to ANOTHER TIRE STORE TO GET THEM TO CHANGE THE LUG NUTS TO THE ONES I PURCHASED. I drive across town to a tire place where they replace my lug nuts in a matter of minutes. $10.
5. Now back to Sam’s at 6:45 (tire place closes at 7:00, but the guy swears he’s going to get it done today because of the trouble I’ve gone through). He decides to take his dear sweet time finding an outlet to plug his phone in and check his text messages, because that’s clearly vital in order to change my tires. I arrived initially at 3:00, and my tires are still not done at 7:15.

I have spent, in its entirety, MORE than a work day getting my tires replaced, which when you consider costs, etc. was MORE EXPENSIVE than spending $1000 to get the dealership to replace my tires.

Moral of the story: I WILL NOT be back to this location to get my tires changed ever. “Save” your money and go somewhere else where the mechanics are better equipped, more knowledgeable, and less lazy.

name: Ashleigh Baker
text: Sadly, this place makes me crazy each and every time I go. Cashiers walk away from their open registers, c.o.s. leads have no sense of urgency and walk slowly to assist if they can be bothered to show up, people cannot be taken away from their conversations with other employees to service members, and, to top it off, their produce is horrible. I love Sam's and have worked for the company in the past in a customer service/marketing role and am now a director of customer service for another company. As a result, this club frustrates me beyond belief, since I know how members can and should be treated. The leadership in this club should promptly be fired and replaced with someone who will hold people accountable and keep the place clean.

Someone had to drive 40mins to bring the card because he said, " I won't take the number over the phone". Horrible customer service. He told me what tire I needed and by the time the card got there he was outside. I proceed to tell the other associate what tire LaDarius said I needed and he walked back in and yelled at the other associate from the length of the store, saying she can only get one tire and said the name of the tire. I was very dissatisfied with Sam's Tire experience and I will not go back nor recommend anyone use them.

name: Trevor Joiner
text: Advance Auto is my go-to store for all things automotive. Tonight, I visited not for automotive needs but guitar needs. I'm a luthier (I build, repair, and restore guitars) and tonight I needed a fine polish to restore the gloss to the lacquer of an old 70s guitar. They didn't have what I was looking for (Meguire's Mirror Glaze #9) but the guy was super, super helpful and friendly. The friendly service, competitive prices, and amazing savings when using coupons for online purchases are why I will come to Advance again and again.

name: Michaela Carter
text: I went in to get an oil filter for my car and told them exactly what I needed. Well the lady rang up the wrong filter and I didn’t recognize it til I paid and picked up the bag and it was way to heavy. I told her that was the wrong one we got it corrected. I paid almost $18 for that and I knew the one I normally get is only around $10-11. So she gets the receipt and is scanning it to refund the difference and i thought it was completed so as I am walking out I check the receipt and nothing was refunded. I go to the back double check the pricing before saying anything went to the front to advise her there was nothing refunded. She proceeded to tell me that I seemed to be in a hurry so she was going to let me go ahead and go but in order to refund the difference I had to swipe my card again. So if you have anything with a price difference to be refunded make sure it actually happens and you get the receipt.

resp.text: Michaela, we apologize for the lack of attention regarding your whole visit to our Muscle Shoals location. Your feedback has been forwarded to the Field Leadership team of this store and they will address any additional training that may be needed. When you come in with exact details of what you want, that should be what you get. We hope that that you do give the store another chance in the future to provide you the proper experience. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts.

resp.text: Hello Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave this review! Here at Advance, we aim to provide exceptional service to all of our customers, and we're sorry to learn that your visit to our Muscle Shoals location resulted in a 1 star rating. Unfortunately, we cannot offer installation of headlight bulbs, however we do provide this service for wiper blades. We did make contact with this store, and unfortunately they were unfamiliar with this incident. We certainly apologize for any inconveniences this may have caused you, and hope for another opportunity to earn your business. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts and Batteries, we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Roy Hunt
text:
Everyone very hush hush, talking  why looking somewhere else, very pessimistic, Doomsday attitude. I know it's all to protect them from liability suits. What ever happened to trust, recommendations, honest opinions? Every answer to every question seemed will rehearsed. Two days later my alternator goes out! Maybe a coincidence, but it seems like everyone I put my trust in the professionals, things start going wrong with my car. Don't trust mechanics, lawyers, maintenance individuals, had one of them tell me, "if we fix it too well, we'll be out of a job, always have to leave something for another day." There's no real honest people in this area, not anymore. Bureaucrats have got their fingers into everything. Law suits are the "American Way!" So you can't really blame them to avoid taking responsibility for their actions. I know what my part costs, they were going to charge me nearly $500 in labor to loosen and tighten bout 6 bolts? A little extreme, they did an estimate but I never got to see it, I asked to see the defective part, but was given the excuse we would have to put it back on the lift. Since it wasn't on the lift, they had no plans to fix it!

Allen from Phenix Firestone called, his only concern was why I was so critical of him. I thought that was clear, but this was the second time I took this vehicle there for the same issue, the first time I was told nothing was wrong with it. In any case in order to resolve the problem Allen stated, "we're not working in your cars anymore!" I guess I hurt his feelings?

I used to love taking a vehicle to Phenix Firestone, always felt like they were looking out for me, always trusted them! Now I get the feeling I'm unimportant, it's really changed over the years!

Enough said hope you all have a great holiday I'll be home fixing my cars! LoL!

resp.text: Roy, thank you for taking the time to leave a thorough review! We welcome all feedback as hearing from our customers is the best way we can improve our business. We apologize for any inconvenience. Take care.

text: I have always had good experiences here until today. I called about a part (a motorcycle spark plug) and asked them to look up the part. I was told to bring the plug in to confirm it was the right thing. I call back with the exact part number to be told that he already told me to bring in the plug to match it and proceeded to interrupt me when I tried to say anything. After refusing to let me speak to the manager on duty I was finally allowed to talk to someone other than this guy and come to find out they didn't even have the plug in stock! Shocker! If only he had looked up the part number for me...never doing business there again.

name: KJ MullinZ
text:
🔥Workers involved:
MIKE (Store Manager)
THOMAS D. (Employee)
Date of incident: 2/20/21 - 4:30-5:00pm.

🔥Bought a refurbished starter from there a few years ago. Returned it because it went bad and had a warranty. Did not want to deal with another refurbished starter, so I requested a brand new one. Was told they cannot get a brand new one which is fine. So they told me I could return the defective refurbished starter I had for a refund so I can use that refund on buying a new starter from another store. At that time, that particular employee was real helpful and kind to me.

Then the incident on 2/20/21 happened when I returned on that date with my defective starter. was dealing with the store manager Mike and his employee Thomas D. at the time. I was told that the starter needed to test bad in order for me to get a refund which is fine, because I had my mechanic test the starter beforehand and I recorded a video as evidence. After waiting a good few minutes because it seemed like something was wrong with the machine, the store manager Mike comes out and says that the starter tested good, but that he would still honor the refund. I told him that's fine, but the starter should have tested bad because my mechanic already tested it and I watched him test it, so I pretty much told Mike that the machine is to blame, then he got defensive and rude with his tone of voice about the machine clearly stating that the machine was not incorrect. To avoid further debating, I directly said to just do the refund. His attitude regarding the situation was unprofessional and unacceptable.

What makes the situation even worse is the fact that the employee Thomas D. asked me for my driver's license on returning the defective starter which should not have happened, because I have my receipt. When I asked him why he's asking for my driver's license, he said they were supposed to do that on returns, but that's obviously not true. Something didn't feel right, so I called another advance Auto parts store about the situation and that store told me that advance auto of Enterprise were in the wrong for taking my driver's license. My driver's license has the address to my Mother's home because it's an old address and I am not comfortable with that address being on file because I'm protective of my mother and concerned for her safety. I do not trust people I don't know, and I definitely do not trust that advance Auto parts store anymore and ever again.

They acted very shady and I felt discriminated because I'm part Asian. I've been shopping there off and on for years for myself and for my Mother. As of now, I am no longer a customer and I want my information out of that system immediately. Yes, I got my refund, but I shouldn't have had to go through that much trouble to get it, or feel that uncomfortable. Everything that happened that day was pretty much recorded on my phone along with two eyewitnesses that were with me in case I need them for future reference.

resp.text: Hello KJ, thank you for leaving your comments about your visit to our Enterprise location. We have forwarded your concerns to the store leadership and apologize for the experience you had. In no way does Advance Auto condone discrimination and we will be investigating the allegations. Please feel free to reach out to our customer service department at 877-238-2623 to provide any more information and thank you for choosing Advance Auto.

While he replaced the battery and connector, we had a great conversation.  I will continue to do business here because of Paul.  Thanks for your friendly attitude in helping a mechanically challenged person.

Kent

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Linda, thank you for submitting your review of our business location. We are sorry you did not have a good customer experience due to the team members at this store. We strive to ensure that all team members are informed and willing to help when assisting customers with parts and inventory needs and we apologize that the store did not meet this goal. At this time, we have sent this information to our Leadership Team and we assure you that they will use this review to improve all services in the store. We hope you give the store another opportunity to serve your automotive needs.

(Original)
Linda, gracias por enviar su reseña de nuestra ubicación empresarial. Lamentamos que no haya tenido una buena experiencia como cliente debido a los miembros del equipo en esta tienda. Nos esforzamos por asegurarnos de que todos los miembros del equipo estén informados y estén dispuestos a ayudar cuando asisten a los clientes con las piezas y las necesidades de inventario y nos disculpamos porque la tienda no alcanzó este objetivo. En este momento, hemos enviado esta información a nuestro Equipo de Liderazgo y le aseguramos que usarán esta revisión para mejorar todos los servicios en la tienda. Esperamos que le brinde a la tienda otra oportunidad para atender sus necesidades automotrices.

text: Edited Review: I've been here a few times now and I do like the experience. The staff continue to be helpful and friendly. text: The gentleman tested the battery,  starter and alternator. Determined the battery was going bad, replaced the battery for me. It was on a 2017 Chevrolet work truck, takes a bit to change the battery but he accomplished it. Great guy, very knowledgeable and provided great service.

text: It's a nice store, but I've been in twice to get washer fluid and they never seem to have any. Seems like a basic thing so I cant give full stars.

name: Bob Burns
text: Great staff on hand helpful and knowledgeable.  Doing front brakes on my 2004 Accord, picked up pads and grease, headed home to start, busted a wheel lug getting the tire off.  Back to the store, had the lug bolt and nuts on hand :).   Always have what I need and if not they have had it there within 90 minutes.  Welcome to the neighborhood, nice to have you in the area.

text: The store is not bad it’s the driveway. I copied the review that I made to the adjoining business that shares the same entrance. It’s the terrible concrete mountains they installed in the front entrance. If your pulling a boat or trailer of any sort be prepared for scuffed rims and dented fenders. And even if your not pulling a trailer be prepared to jump rockie mountains and slam down into the Grand Canyon when turning in. Whoever decided to install this needs to go back to architecture school because they FAILED. So please tear down the Berlin Wall so that customers can come and go without destroying their property!!

name: Destiny Hollie
text: Went to the auto center on 12/20/19 to have a high mileage oil change done. While waiting in line workers were yelling about how their cashier wasn’t in the auto center and were telling people to go to another cashier not in auto center then when they got to me the worker asked me about my car and as I was telling them the information they interrupted me to answer another workers question and then said “what did you say?” And I had to repeat myself so zero stars for customer service. The wait for the oil change was what I expected for Walmart but then I get home and park and when I go to warm up my car for work I saw a puddle under my car and my oil plug. On the SAME day I had my oil changed. Will NEVER go back to Hamilton Walmart Auto-center again since I’m now going to have to jack my car up to put the oil plug back on and buy more oil.  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.

text:
HAMILTON AL WALMART TIRE CENTER Every time i go in there I have to stand at the register waiting for 15-30 minutes before I have to go find somebody that doesn't even work the register to come and assist me. They are SLOWWWWWWWWWWWWW!
always 5-8 cars waiting. Takes 3 hours to get an oil change. They stripped out my oil drain plug and then they waited 2 1/2 hours to tell me about it. Then they sent me somewhere else to get it fix and to get my oil changed. They charged me for somebody else oiled change then it took 1 1/2 hours for them to refund me my money. DONT WAST 2-4 HOURS OUT OF YOUR DAY GETTING NEW TIRES OR AN OIL CHANGE WHEN YOU CAN GO TO QUICK LUBE ACROSS FROM THE FIRST STATE BANK AND GET AN OIL CHSNGE IN 10 MINUTES WITH NO WAIT TIME
