name: Erin Marie
text: This is the place to go for all of your tire needs! If I could give them 10 stars I would. The location is extremely clean, the staff are excellent, & the customer service is phenomenal. Corey, the general manager, understood my needs & the urgency of it. He went above & beyond to help me get my wheel fixed as soon as possible!! Everybody is so friendly & Corey is FANTASTIC. He is so great about calling customers with updates, I never even had to call them to ask about updates. I recommend this location & I will continue to come to this location for all my car/tire needs! Thank you guys so much, especially Corey, y’all are the best!!!!

resp.text: Awesome! Glad we could get you safely on the road, Erin. We will see ya again when ya need us.

text: Very dishonest place! Claimed I only had 1-2 mm of brake pads left on my rear brakes and that my rotors were "cracked"... Pads actually had 50% life remaining and rotors were fine! Do not trust their assessments of anything without inspecting yourself or with a qualified mechanic.

resp.text: Honesty is one of our core values and we take all customers feedback to heart. Thank you for alerting us, Jason. We would like to connect you with a TD Rep to learn more and address your concern. Would you mind sending your preferred contact information to tirediscounters.com/contact? We look forward to connecting.

text: Corey and the team did an excellent job replacing my car's tires with an alignment. The car now drives like a new one. I witnessed the team helping other customers in detail while I waited. Thanks!

resp.text: Aww, group hug. We love having you in the TD family, Chris. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

text:
Service at this Tire Discounter location was speedy and convenient. We used their “Skip the Shop” service  to have them drop the vehicle back off at my home after completing the service. I live close by, but it’s still a huge convenience to be able to just drop it off and not have to have a ride back to pick it up.  They can also come and pick up your vehicle, but I didn’t know about it until after dropping it off. This service was free of charge with any service of $50+. Sam brought out car back and was very polite and professional. A+
- Tanner Armstrong

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review! Glad you were able to utilize the Skip the Shop services, too, Tanner. How AWESOME, right?! Take care and we'll see ya again anytime ya need us.

name: Shaun Bundy
text: I would give zero stars if could, because that's exactly how much service I received. Had a 2pm appointment for oil change, showed up at 1:45pm. He said they would get right on it. At 3:20pm, over 1.5 hours later, I hadn't heard a peep from anyone. I got up to check on it, on crutches BTW, and see my vehicle sitting in the parking lot. I thought it was complete, and asked why no one let me know. He informed me that they hadn't even touched it yet. I asked for my keys, and voiced my displeasure. He handed me my keys, and never once offered any kind  of apology . Why take appointments if you have no intention of honoring it?!

resp.text: Thank you for the alert, Shaun. We definitely respect your time & take your feedback seriously. We do get backed up from time to time, but the team should be providing updates throughout to let you know of any unexpected delays. That being said, we'd like to connect & learn more. If possible, please send your preferred method of contact to support@tirediscounters.com. Once received, a member of the team will reach out. We value your insight and hope to chat soon.

text: These guys are awesome! They have always treated us right. My wife works next door and they will bring the car to her and drop it off. Every time we have taken any of our vehicles there the work is excellent, employees are kind and caring and they work hard to get you fixed and on your way! I highly recommend this location!! Thanks Guys!!!!

resp.text: Aww, group hug! We love having you and your wife in the TD family, Phillip. You've got us for life!

name: Daniel Webster
text: I purchased almost 2 thousand dollars worth of tires from this location for a 2008 dodge dually in September 2020. On February 15th 2021 I took truck in for a rotation and brake inspection. They did the rotation wrong and put two tires that were worn way down and put on outer tears which started skinning them fast. Less than 200 miles down the road and the rear brake pads were metal on metal yet they supposedly just did a brake inspection. Today I took truck back so they could address the issues they cause and they wanted me to pay for their errors. I was fine with covering costs of brakes but the tires was their error. They did want to take care of me the customer. I picked my truck up and will leave this same review on every site I can find and contact an attorney Monday morning to address this matter.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, Daniel. We've got an open ticket for ya in our system and we'll be in touch to get to the bottom of this soon. Make sure to send us your contact info if you haven't already done so to support@tirediscounters.com. Talk soon.

resp.text: Woohoo! We love having you in the TD family, Jennifer. We will see ya again when ya need us.

resp.text: We rock so you can roll. Happy to have ya in the TD family, Pierre. You've got us for life.

name: Stephen Youngblood
text:
I made an 8 am appointment to get one tire changed. I learned don’t ever make an 8 am appointment. It’s 830 and my truck still hasn’t even been pulled in so now I have to scramble to reschedule meetings this morning. Use discount tire instead they keep their appointment times and don’t have people laying out tire displays instead of taking care of customers. Then when they get it in and go to put the new tire on the guy stands there for 5 minutes texting instead of installing my tire....over an hour and a half for one tire as the first appointment of the day and first one signed in.

DO NOT USE FIND SOMEWHERE BETTER

resp.text: Hi Stephen, we apologize that we did not meet your expectations. We take great pride in our craft and try to ensure that all of our services are completed to process and timely. We have pulled up your invoice and will be creating a customer escalation ticket to be reviewed by the Regional Manager who will be contacting you shortly. Thank you for being a valued Tire Discounters customer and we hope to see you again when you need us!

text: I was late for work, I had a flat, and my tire was way too worn out to be patched. I couldn’t catch a break this month. All the other tire shops were expensive for something unexpected. I decided to try out Tire Discounters, and they found me a great deal on a set of tires and fixed me up real quick. Thanks, for being a hero for me that day! They gave me my break. I needed that win for the day! The customer service was friendly and professional. The next day the manger gave me a follow up call to make sure everything was okay, I’ve never had that happen from a tire shop.

text:
Brought my car in as it was pulling to the right, they checked the alignment and it was not out.
They test drove it and could not duplicate the pull. I insisted that there was a pull, so they rotated the tires.
I only had a short drive home but I felt a difference, I will find out on the drive to work in the morning.
The service was top notch and they were very friendly and professional. The shop and waiting area was very clean.
I now know where I will take my car from now on.
I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: Awesome! Glad we could get you safely on the road, Thomas. Take care and we will see ya again when you need us.

text: These guys are incredible. ALL OF THEM! I have always gone to Discount Tires ...up until now.  I have never met a bunch of guys with better customer service than these guys. Each and every one of them genuinely cared about our situation and never stopped trying to help us figure it out and get us back on the road. These guys went out of there way and took care of us and got what we needed done.  If I even lived in a 50 mile radius of this store and these guys they would have my business all day long. I cant say enough about these guys... it makes me feel really good that there are still people like this on this planet.  Don't go anywhere else, I can promise you that theres nobody else going to take care of you better than they can.

name: Steve Zanussi
text:
After noticing at a road stop that there was a bubble on the sidewall of my tire while on a long trip, I went to the closest Tire Discounters I could find.  There I was told that it would be at least three hours to change my tire.  They referred me to this location--8873 Highway 72, Huntsville--several miles away.

Upon entering I was greeted by the General Manager, Tyler Thurmond, who assessed the tire, and notified me that they did not have my tire in stock.  (They did have it in stock at the first place, but they had never checked.)  Tyler told me that it would take an hour and a half to get the tire there, but that once they had it, it could be put on very quickly.

Tyler had the delivery of the tire expedited for us, because we mentioned that we had to get up north by a set time.  The entire visit took about 45 minutes, including the delivery of the tire.

Thank you so much, Tyler Thurmond, for your exceptional customer service.  If I find myself needing a tire in Huntsville again, I know where I will go.

resp.text: Wowzeritos! Thanks for the review, Steve. We really appreciate the 5 stars and hope to see ya again for any of your tire or auto care needs! Take a look at our full services at https://tirediscounters.com/services

name: Andrew Smith
text: BUYER BEWARE!  I would recommend to do research on any pricing they give you.  Here is what happened.  Called got a verbal quote of $139-189 per axle for a brake job with rotor's turned which is fair they are just below the dealer which was $200 per axle.  Went the next day to have services done to my car.  Before they began work they inspected it and determine I needed pads all the way and rotor's on the rear and a brake fluid exchange.  Estimate price was over $700.  I declined the brake fluid exchange and they offered some "competitive" discounts brought my total down to about $580.  Still more than it should be.  Asked for a printed estimate when I saw the estimate I knew something was up.  They had part numbers and prices on the estimate.  Quick Google search confirmed the part numbers and prices from a local part supply store that they would be getting the parts from.  They are marking up parts pricing 100+%.  Industry standard is between 10-25%.  Then they told me that the estimate was nearly at cost and if he went any lower he would lose his job.  Nothing but scam and scare tactics were used with me and I didn't take the bait.  Tried to email the address on the general managers card it wouldn't ever go through.  Called the corporate office gave them the info and the pictures I have attached here and they said a regional manager would get back with me still have not heard from that person either.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE AND THE CHECK ANY PRICES THEY GIVE YOU!

resp.text: We take pride in our craft and place a great amount of emphasis on pricing ourselves competitively. We are continuously evaluating. We want to dig in to learn more. If you are willing, please send your preferred contact information to support@tirediscounters.com. We look forward to connecting you with a TD team member soon.

Jody and Sarah got my car  straight in to the garage and my tire being fixed.  The customer service that the two of them and there staff showed today helped turn a bad day into a BLESSED DAY. My daughter and I sat for a little bit and before I knew it the tire was repaired. Thanks  guys for helping us out ! We will definitely come back to see you in the future !

name: Abigail Cantrell
text: I haven't actually bought tires here, but I felt a need to add a voice saying for a place called tire Discounters they have ridiculously expensive tires.  They are $100 more for a set of 4 than Goodyears at other stores, and it was an off brand I'd never heard of.  They were almost $200 dollars more than Goodyears at my new favorite tire place if you include the "free" alignment.  They told me that includes the warranty and installation, but so does anyone.  I haven't even called Walmart for prices yet, but my point is, do your comparison shopping, and don't believe the name.

name: Ellis Eskew
text: I took my car to McGriff Auto after my passenger side doors got hit by another car. They did an amazing job! Even touched up paint on other parts of the car that weren’t caused by the wreck. My car was cleaned inside and out and felt like new! I would highly recommend them.

text: Keith is AMAZING!! He is the only one I trust my car to.

name: Edward Pugh Jr
text: Keith was wonderful.  He diagnosed .my issues and fixed my problem.  He made other repair suggestions and even offered to help me order parts where I could save money.  He seemed to be genuine, honest, and very personsable.  I would gladly recommend them to anyone.

text: This is now my go to shop due to the kind assistance I refused and the helpful information on saving time and money for needed repairs.

name: Nicole Gerlach
text: Keith is a godsend. He's reliable, honest, and fair and the only person I will ever let touch my vehicle. Go to McGriffs if you want good, honest work.

name: Rhonda Fowler
text: Our AC went out on the way from Birmingham to Pensacola. We stopped and within an hour they had it fixed at a very reasonable price. I recommend them to anyone.

name: Jessie Barksdale
text: Walt and his team take great care of their customers! I've used McGriff's for everything from oil changes, routine maintenance, new tires, body work and painting over the years. I won't trust anyone else with my car. Highly recommend!

text: McGriff is the best. They found the issue quickly and offered a fair price as always. I almost spent $90 on an engine diagnostic, which would have been a total waste of money.

text: I typically do work on my own vehicle as I am so skeptical of auto shops. When I was unable to do a repair myself I brought my import here. Great people, friendly, knowledgeable, quick service AND affordable! Will come back for any future needs for sure.

text: Lived in many states, seen many mechanics/shops. McGriffs is the best ever. Upfront fair pricing, work always done right the first time...and the customer service is unsurpassed. Also, if you work on base, I highly recommend - so easy to drop off outside main gate and get to/from work.

name: Curator Veritatis
text: I have not had very good luck with the Sam's Tire Center at this location. I purchased my tires at a different store, but since moving to Huntsville, I have had all of my balancing done here. Sadly, most of the employees here are not very skilled when it comes to balancing, but that doesn't stop them. If you have wheels that you would like to keep in good condition, don't go to Sam's. These guys use conventional weights that wreak havoc on allow wheels when mounted externally, which they do. The last time I was here, the shop tech that was helping me replaced one of my wheels without its center cap. I walked back into the shop and asked that he find the missing cap. He did find it, but had I not inspected his work in the parking lot, I'm sure that it would have been thrown away, and I'd be driving around without one. Lazy!

name: Darryl Harlow
text: First three kids on Sunday told my sister to use channel locks instead of a line wrench to do the job line wrenches are designed to do, take off, and reinstall break lines. They seriously told her, then me, use channel locks, or vise grips! My reply was, uh, somebody Else might want to work on the break lines at some point!!! Then the next day, the grouchy old guy ringing us up for the correct parts, refused to give me my military discount, even though I had my VA card, and had mentioned it before he finished the transaction! For crying out loud, it was applied to the first purchase, that was returned because they were the wrong dang parts! I'm sorry, but after my third visit to this store, I'll drive to the fairhope store, Foley store, or Robertsdale store before I'll go to this store ever again, it was as bad as the one in Mobile.

resp.text: This is never the impression we should leave, Darryl. Being knowledgeable about auto parts and providing the best customer experience is what AutoZone is all about. We're disappointed we let you down. We're always listening to our customers and making improvements. We hope you give us another chance in the future to take care of your automotive needs. Thank you for sharing your experience.

resp.text: We're glad you had a great experience with us, Tom! Customer service is a priority for us and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we're doing. We hope you continue to trust AutoZone!

text:
This place is a pathetic JOKE!

Open. NOT near closing time. NOBODY in front of us. NO other potential "customers" there. At least 4 employees dedicated to the Service Center department. And they state they CANNOT check a tire for a simple leak and plug it if needed.

I mean seriously,... what a PATHETIC JOKE of a "service" center.  Please avoid Walmart at all costs.

If you need quality friendly tire service go across the road to City Tire in Pell City, Al

text: For the price good. Wait time is not good. Need to hire more.

name: Michaela Robbins
text: The worst experience I've ever had getting tires. I would leave zero stars if I could. I purchased 4 tires online because of their low price. I went to get them put on 3 different times each time they had over 2 hour wait. Then when I finally decided to do it it took them over an hour to just locate my tires that were ordered online. I specifically told them I wanted my tires back when checking out. Three hours later when my car was finished they said they had cut up my previous tires and I wouldn't want them back. I had looked at my tires the day before going and there were at least 10,000 miles left on them. They preceded to show me tires that were worn until the belts were showing, which were not the tires I drove in there with. I would not recommend this Walmart tire center to my worst enemy.

To the best of my observations, they performed regular maintenance on two cars since I've been here.

name: Wesley Saenz
text: Wait time 2 hours and 15 minutes ... and counting. I would say poor management because of possibility of undermanned shop, but these guys move slower than molasses. Just picture the slowest moving object you've ever seen, well that's times 10. I am all about enjoying a work day and having conversations to distract your mind, but when you have 20 customers lined up and average wait time is 2 hours? Time to hustle and bustle!! Current wait time 2 hours and 20 minutes...for 1 tire!

name: robert crabtree
text:
Slow!!! CSM standing at the register, but hasn't done anything. Attendant is running around overloaded. Mechanics busy coking and joking with other associates (whom are on break behind the building).
Went in for one tire. Somehow the 3 people behind me in line, from the beginning, got their tires mounted and were on their way, yet I am still waiting. Standard size tire (235/75/15) subpar service.
I WILL NOT be returning. Even if I have a flat, this Walmart won't see a penny of the cost or a second of my time.

name: GG
text: 1st and last time visit to this location. Took my car in for 4 new tires and the associate who placed the tires broke a part off of the wheel and didn't bother to tell me nor did he write anything in the comment section of the receipt I was given.  I didn't find out it was broken until my car started vibrating when I applied the brakes. After already waiting 2 hours the 1st time I went in and then having to wait 2 1/2 hours the 2nd time I am done with this location.  There were workers just standing around while a line of cars waited to be worked on. I heard several complaints from folks sitting around me and have to say everything I heard was true. The dept. seems very disorganized when it comes organizing the flow of cars in the bays to be worked on. Only 1 person was working the counter and they seemed very overwhelmed .

name: Walt H
text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

resp.text: Thank You For The Great Review

name: Brian Toner
text: Great service. Dropped my car off Monday morning, got a call that afternoon detailing what the problem was and the price for the fix, picked the car up Monday before 5. Did not try to up charge me, only fixed the problem I came in for. Will be coming here next time I need service.

text: This was what I experienced a while ago. It was until today I know I got ripped off...a lot. I am new to USA so I don't know a lot of common stuff. They told me that this is a very hard job (lie) and they have some fancy $100k dollar machine that can read the engine light code. So I paid them $150 for reading the code. Until now I found that Autozone can do it for free with exactly the same machine which itself cost less than $150. Lol. Very bad experience. Very blantant lie. I wouldn't trust these guys with anything. Your car is very important and car accident can cost your life so don't let liars touch it.

But they tightened the cables so much so that it is IMPOSSIBLE to get them off to take the battery in for testing and even bent part of the battery cable. We tried forever to unhook it till the point that the cable broke with the nut still attached to the battery. So now we have to replace both the battery AND the cable. 0 stars for further breaking my car.

text:
On Nov. 7, 2018 I went in to get an oil change. Told me it might be awhile, that was ok with me, had to shop anyways.
About an hour later the called me, as I was driving away I noticed they had not reset my oil life gauge..I turned around went back and they acted like it wasnt a big deal. But, they reset it.
On the 17th of Nov a team of of us went to Kinard Fl to give a Thanksgiving dinner to that community. On the highway, the plate under the car that protects the engine fell on the road, the noise made me pull to side of road. Luckily, there was a mechanic with us, who got under the car and took it off..
It was put back on with a plastic screw and a zip tie From getting my oil changed!
Needless to say, walmart TLC will never see me again...or about 25+ people in this area who were either with me or have heard this story..We are still telling it btw.

I tried to go to other tire shops in the area(just to get a tire put on) & was told I would have to WAIT until that afternoon, just to put on a tire! I went here & was in/out within 45 minutes! name: e douglas pratt
text:
Friday January 17 and Saturday the 18th, 2020, Michael and Jonathan at the Oxford, Alabama Firestone store exceeded my expectations . I was traveling from Atlanta to Birmingham when my tire light went on. I made it on my run-flat to their store. They showed me the irreparable damage and found a tire in Birmingham. It would be delivered Saturday; but the Saturday delivery failed to bring that tire. Instead of waiting til Monday, Michael and Jon immediately offered to get the tire from Birmingham themselves. Jonathan made the trip and I was driving safely away later Saturday afternoon. Michael, Jonathan, and their Oxford, Alabama team make Firestone look very good. Please give them a substantial raise. If that's not immediately forthcoming, please embarrass them with lavish praise at your next regional meeting.

Dr. E. Douglas Pratt
Atlanta, Georgia

text:
While the price for my tires and oil change were less than quoted, I do have some complaints: the employee did NOT do requested alignment
he tried talking me into "Fuel System Cleaning" & Renu Fuel System
Cleaner" ($89.99 & $9.99) which I just had done 2 wks prior at my
dealer)
DID NOT cold pressure balance my tires (from the photo of my dash PSI
info: LF 39 RF 39; LR 38 RR 43--what the heck??); on 2009 Chev HHR LS recommended PSI is 30-32 for 15s, 16s respectively. While it won't necessarily affect mileage that much for minor variations, it will affect the wear and tear.
It makes me mad when MEN in the automotive industry think they can pull things over on women. LADIES BE AWARE.
It pays to be an informed consumer and to listen, and if they are slick salesmen like the one serving me, listen twice as hard because he made me think that the alignment check was the alignment being done. Shame shame shame.

** This happened at the Oxford Quintard Mall location but it won't let me put my review on their page.

name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: Brought my car that was occasionally stalling out to get diagnosed and fixed up. They found the issue and fixed it. Within 2 minutes, my car died in the middle of the street. The bumping and RPM fluctuations progressively got worse, and by the time i was able to get off the road, the car would only coast in drive. If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

text:
Absolutely stay away from this location. Do not trust them to perform a simple oil change. When you are charged for an oil filter that is not installed, it is called fraud. When you refuse to stand behind your work, You are not reputable. If you expect them to return your calls, you will be waiting till the cows come home.

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action.  If you proclaim that you are customer oriented and responsive, just do the right thing and pay for the parts charged but not installed and the damage you caused.

text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

resp.text: Earning the trust of our customers is paramount to our team, Richard, which is why it's so disappointing to learn you feel this way. name: The Eclectic Mama creator
text: I went twice to get tires put on ...they did not listen to me when I told them what I needed . They made there own choice on what tires needed replacing and almost got rid of still good tires I had on there before. When in there own policy it states they are not to gage tires to know what’s bad or not.  they had claimed that the tires they had taken off were bad and practically said the second day I came in that they did me a favor even though my truck broke there lift that they should not of put on there lift in the first place but it was my fault. They acknowledged that there lift would not work  because my truck was too big....but went ahead and put my truck on the lift anyway the first day. Now the tires they were supposed to remove one was too big and was throwing off the trucks balance due to a different Walmart tire center. And the other one was a balding spare tire that they apparently did not look at at all or they would have not taken the still good tires off and almost through them away. The only good thing they did is make me realize that they can’t be trusted to do the job ....and don’t communicate with the customer properly. There may have been some polite people there at first but the second day I was there to get the problem fixed thinking they would be professional about it instead this I guess manager raised her voice at me and made all these claims that I had said this ...when I thought it was because I asked for a rotation I thought I had confused them and they had assumed what was right. I was not blaming anyone, I just wanted the work I paid for to be done. There were a few things that maybe on me but if they were real professional people they would not of teamed up against me like they did. In the end I went to a different tire shop and I did ask them to put on the tires Walmart almost thrown away and to gage them before putting it on to make sure they were not bad. And this other tire shop I went too said “ no your tire ain’t bad they still got a couple years on them if you use the truck regularly”

name: Rose Burgess
text: The cashier was too busy talking about everything to her co workers. The customers waited in line until she finished this conversation about a customer who had walked away with the co worker.   She waited on me and when I explained that my tire was only 14 days old and had a screw in the side wall I asked if the tire was to be patched or replaced.  The young lady proceeded to explain to me what road hazard meant and a new tire was out of the question (very loudly I must say).   The co worker who fixes the tires spoke up and said if the tire has a screw in the side wall the tire most likely will be replaced.  I thanked him and sat down.   This same cashier called me to the desk to get checked out.  I had to wait while she redid the paperwork so her supervisor could understand what happened (which did not understand).   So I waited till she rewrote everything and I was asked to  pay a pro rated amount of 11.00 for the new tire.  I paid this amount with no comment because she was so (confrontational and annoying) even though I felt it wasn't fair.  But that's the kind of people you meet today in stores they do not understand the meaning of customer service.  The service team did a great job, the wait for changing the tire wasn't long at all.

name: Courtney Souders
text: These people have no sense of urgency. Was quoted 30 minutes for a tired repair. More than an hour later they came to tell me they would be unable to do the repair. Slow and entirely unhelpful. Will make the drive, even with a damaged tire, to a reputable, efficient place next time.

name: Adonis Medallo
text: I would like to thanks all the people working there for their kindness and great services.

name: Koju Celeste
text: A year ago,I had to get my oil change before I headed back home to Tennessee and so I chose somewhere quick so I could head home faster and not have to worry about getting my oil changed when I got home to Tennessee. I went to Walmart and the service was alright,no flaws or anything. And from there,I headed straight to Tennessee and as I was driving home,I smelled burning oil,but I thought it was just a little bit that burns just as usual. Now mind you,my home was 3 hours away from Sumiton Alabama. When I got home,I looked under the hood and they left my oil cap off and my whole engine was drenched in oil! (To this day,I’m still replacing ignition coils that have been misfiring and still find oil in the spark plugs) Luckily,the oil cap was still sitting where they had left it. Every time I get an oil change,no matter where I go,I look under the hood to make sure they’ve got it on there.

name: Jerry Caradine
text: Very disappointed with the management staff in today's trip. According to the employees which were very understaffed, all management was scheduled off and there were only 2 people scheduled in the shop. The 1 cashier that did work there quit yesterday because she was not allowed off today. The backup cashier there to help didn't have access to any of the systems which defeated the purpose. The 2 shop personnel kept having to stop to answer calls or write up tickets. This wasn't allowing any work to get completed. Fortunately I had trailer tires with me that I could leave and come back for later. Otherwise it was going to be a 2 hour wait. For 2 tires! Again this wasn't on the people there in the shop as they were as nice as can be about it. This came down to poor management decisions. Unfortunately, the employees will be the ones to pay the price with the rude customers that will become annoyed at the time things take today.

name: Mandy Chandler
text: This is an absolute treasure of a repair shop. I'm used to being able to do everything myself or have my father do repairs--but since moving across the country and living in an apartment, that's no longer possible. This place is not only a car saver--they're a wallet saver as well.  I was quoted less than half the price of another shop and had my car ready that same afternoon. Incredibly fast and honest work. I highly recommend using Mike's for your car repair needs.

name: shana alford
text: Some kid help me. Looked like he just blazed out back. When I gave him the vin number and type of car he kept asking if that was the part I needed. I dont know is it? Two older gentlemen who were obviously more experienced were right next to us and didnt bother to help. We were obviously having issues. I ended up returning both parts

resp.text: Shana, we are sorry to hear that your experience with our team member hasn't been up to par. We hope we can change this in the future! Thanks for the training opportunity your feedback provides. - O'Reilly Auto Parts

name: Clint Eaves
text: Greg the assistant manager is amazing. He was super helpful throughout the entire process. Had to make at least 4 trips back and fourth to get everything I needed for my jeep. I came here from out of town and needed a lot of help to get my truck running and they helped with everything. Great customer service. Would recommend this place to everybody. Great job from these guys.

name: Shari Quinn
text: Need a smog check? Go here and hope you get Ricky. He's incredibly efficient and probably one of the nicest guys you'll meet. I got in at 5:45, and was out the door, paperwork submitted to the DMV and all, at 6 pm on the dot.

name: Kimberly Rogers
text: My go to guys. Honest and fairly priced. Real Daly City fixture! Fast and reliable, they'll even keep you occupied laughing if you're waiting for your vehicle to finish.

name: Joshua Kesling
text: The guys that work here go above and beyond. They did a fantastic job with me. Helped me for over an hour and asked nothing in return- fantastic staff and I highly recommend them for all of your automotive parts needs.

name: cody young
text: My battery died today and needed to be replaced. It was still under warranty from the business i purchased it at, but they gave me a hard time and gave me bad information. At Oreillys, the man who tested my battery today was literally the only person who was not dismissive and did not talk down to me.Regret not getting his name when i was there today, but i appreciated his help very much. I will be a return customer for sure.

Since that day, they have always been and will continue  to be my first call. I am a master technician with high standards of quality and professionalism. O'Reillys has their act together all the way up to the top. 👍👍
